title: Backend Software Engineer
description:
Are you interested in working on exciting challenges within high transaction environments? We are looking for you who are curious, can take initiative and come up with new creative solutions, and care about ultimately delivering a great product.  
 


  

 The Role
   


 Our Engagement Area in Product Development is growing and we are now looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to join! Engagement at Betsson Group ensures our customers come back for more. It’s all about loyalty. We provide a world class customer experience beyond the game play featuring Tournaments, Dynamic personalized campaigns and much more! 
 


  


 You will be part of preparing our journey to containerization, increasing the scalability of our systems while also maintaining their high quality. To accommodate new requirements, we are constantly re-evaluating our systems design and working on exciting new features.
 


  

 You have experience in
   

  
* C#, .NET, .NET Core
  
* SQL Server and NoSQL databases
  
* Unit testing frameworks
  
* Messaging within a micro service architecture
  
* Agile development
  
* Collaboration / knowledge-sharing
  


  

 Extra awesome
   

  
* Kafka
  
* Experience in a modern front-end framework (e.g. Angular)
  
* Docker containerization
  
* Domain driven design
  


  

 What’s in it for you?
   


 We can offer you an environment full of ambition and passion. One day is never like the other as the only constant is change, to the better, to the greater. We strive to be the best in whatever field we choose to play on, and we make sure to have fun along the way!
 


  

  
* A friendly, open and humble working environment, where you will have the chance to work alongside with colleagues from all over the world
  
* A chance to evolve your skills together with your colleagues with various programs and initiatives
  
* Personal development through courses, in-house training and external certification
  
* Freedom with responsibility
  


  

 Challenge Accepted?
   


 Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our tech colleagues are talking about.
 


  


 By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy

title: Full-stack Developer
description:
Tech Driven Fullstack Developer Intern
   

 Gaddr · Sweden (Remote)
   

  

 About the job
   

  

 Are you a passionate developer with a strong foundation in fullstack development, and are you eager to work on a fullstack role with an emphasis on backend technology?
   

  

 Do you have experience with Next.js on the frontend and Node.js on the backend? If you’re excited about working with AI and Rust, this could be the perfect opportunity for you!
   

  

 What You’ll Be Doing
   

  

 As a Fullstack Developer Intern with a primary focus on backend development, you’ll work on real projects that drive growth and success for startups in our network.
   

  

 Please Note: This is an unpaid internship and our tech company is in the very early stages of development. This role is ideal for someone who is excited about working in a startup environment and is looking to build a strong portfolio with real-world educational projects.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

 Backend Development: Building and enhancing backend services with a strong focus on Node.js, while exploring Rust for performance optimization and scalability.
   

  

 Frontend Development: Implementing and refining features on the frontend using Next.js, ensuring seamless interaction with backend services.
   

  

 API & Microservices: Developing APIs, working on microservices architecture, and optimizing backend workflows to support scalable, high-performance applications.
   

  

 Code Review & Best Practices: Participating in code reviews, debugging, and learning best practices in software engineering and DevOps.
   

  

 What We Offer:
   

  

 Hands-On Development Experience: Contribute to high-impact projects for diverse startups, allowing you to build valuable skills in both backend and frontend development.
   

  

 Learning-Focused Environment: While this role is unpaid, the skills and insights you’ll gain will position you strongly in fullstack development, Rust, blockchain, and Next.js.
   

  

 Career Growth: Build your resume and portfolio with real-world achievements in backend and frontend development.
   

  

 Mentorship: Learn from experienced developers and startup founders, gaining industry insight and guidance.
   

  

 What We’re Looking For
   

  

 Solid Node.js and Backend Knowledge: You have experience building backend applications with Node.js and a desire to dive deeper.
   

  

 Experience with Next.js: You’re comfortable working on the frontend with Next.js and eager to enhance your fullstack expertise.
   

  

 Interest in Rust & Blockchain: You’re curious about Rust and blockchain technology and ready to explore these skills.
   

  

 Problem-Solving Mindset: You enjoy tackling challenges and finding innovative solutions.
   

  

 Adaptability: You thrive in a fast-paced startup environment, where each day brings new learning opportunities.
   

  

 About the Startups
   

  

 These are early-stage companies within Francisco’s incubator program, so your contributions will play a vital role in their growth and development.
   

  

 Ready to Apply?
   

  

 If you’re excited to learn, innovate, and work across the stack with Node.js, Next.js, Rust, and blockchain, submit your application and start your journey today

title: Jr Product Developer - Womenswear, Shoes
description:
**Job Description**
*Are you passionate about fashion, trends, and have a strong interest in creating and developing a shoe assortment that our customers love?*
*We’re now looking for a driven and curious Junior Product Developer to join our Womenswear Shoes team at H&M. If you thrive in a fast-paced, creative environment and want to grow your skills in product development – this is your opportunity to make an impact and shape the future of our global assortment.*
**What You’ll Do**
 As a Jr Product Developer for Shoes at H&Ms Womenswear department you will have an important role in the exciting and complex process of creating products for ouour collection be sold in all our sales countries – all over the world.
   

  

 Together with a tight team, you work with identifying and developing our shoes assortment according to current and upcoming global trends. Your main responsibility will be to support the Product Developer in creating the best shoes for our customers. This role offers the opportunity to work cross functional, collaborating with a Product Manager, Designers and Planners through the development process. You will be an important link between teams; you will drive the process forward and help ensure seamless coordination between different functions.
   

  

 As a Junior Product Developer, you will be part of our daily operational business, with many ongoing tasks – you will be involved in everything from sample handling, to ensuring our collection are developed according to our strategy.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
* At least one year of experience in product development or buying, preferably within fashion or footwear
* A strong interest in shoes and a desire to grow and specialize within this product category
* Relevant education in Textiles, Buying, or Product Development
* A commercial mindset with a strong drive to contribute to business growth
* A deep understanding of the womenswear customer and a sharp eye for fashion and trends
* A structured and organized way of working, with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
* A collaborative and communicative team player who thrives in a cross-functional environment with a humble and hands-on approach
* A curious mindset and eagerness to continuously learn and develop
* Strong commercial thinking, with the ability to spot opportunities for growth and profitability
* A passion for finding smarter ways of working and driving improvements in everyday tasks


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**JOIN US**
**Additional information:**
 This is a full time position, with placement in Stockholm. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role,
 **please send your application including CV in English as soon as possible.** 
 Interviews will be held continuously. (For internal candidates, please initiate a dialogue with you manager before applying.)  If you are currently in a permanent employment with H&M you will keep your permanent employment even if you take on a temporary position for a limited time.
   

  

**Benefits:**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity:**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
Are you a ready to use your skills for something that truly matters? Maybe you’ve built countless apps, optimized endless user flows, or maintained systems that never quite made a difference in people’s lives. Now, imagine putting your skills to work for something bigger - something that actually changes how healthcare, social services, and elderly care work together in Sweden.
   

  

 We’re building a next-generation platform that will transform collaboration across these vital sectors. We are now looking for experienced Fullstack Developers, who are ready to use their craft to make a real impact.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
* Meaningful mission: Directly influence the future of Swedish healthcare and social services.
* Technical Leadership: Take ownership of architecture, drive technical decisions, and mentor colleagues.
* Modern tech & AI: Work with React, TypeScript, Java, Spring Boot, Docker, Kubernetes and AI-driven development.
* Growth & collaboration: Learn from talented colleagues and have access to mentorship and growth opportunities.
* Flexible culture: Enjoy flexible working conditions and a friendly culture built on trust and care.


**The position**
 You’ll be part of an agile and innovative team, contributing throughout the entire development lifecycle — from requirements to production-ready services. Depending on your experience, you’ll either grow into the role or take a lead in driving development and mentoring others.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Develop and maintain a modern, API-first platform using test-driven and AI-assisted methods.
* Mentor and support other developers, fostering a culture of technical excellence.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (designers, product owners, domain experts) to deliver secure, scalable, and user-friendly solutions.
* Contribute to architectural decisions for scalability, performance, and security
* Stay at the forefront of technology and share your expertise with the team.


**About You**
 You are curious, eager to learn, and enjoy working with others. You thrive in an environment where you can grow your skills step by step, contribute with your ideas, and collaborate to solve problems together.
   

  

 At Cambio, we value initiative and personal growth. Our culture is built on Trust, Care, and Together values we believe are important to both our work and our people. It’s important to us that you recognize and identify with these values.
   

  

**Requirements**
* A passionate engineer with 5+ years of experience building great products using cutting-edge technologies
* Curiosity about AI and enthusiasm for exploring new technologies.
* Excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English


**Additional Information**
* Place of employment: Linköping, Motala or Stockholm
* Scope: Full-time, hybrid work model (three days per week in-office)
* Form of employment: Permanent employment, 6 months trial period


 We review applications and conduct interviews on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

**CAMBIO- FOR A HEALTHIER TOMORROW**
 Welcome to a company where healthcare is improved every day. Here you will work with leading technology in a collaborative, trusting and empowering environment where your contribution will be appreciated and celebrated. In our caring culture you will have the opportunity to pursue different paths of professional growth. Seize the opportunity to do the most important work of your life
 **.** 
 Read more about us
 **here!**
**A healthier tomorrow also means taking care of those who make it possible** 
**-** 
 explore our employee benefits
   

  

 Learn more about our recruitment process here
   

  

 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at our career site.
   

  

 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**Location** 
 : Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Start** 
 : Early December 2025
   

  

**Duration** 
 : Parental leave cover starting January 2026 (approx. 12 months)
   

  

**Employment type:** 
 Full-time, hybrid (office / remote)
   

  

 We at Maandag Nordic is looking for a Frontend Developer to join a dynamic development team, filling in for a team member on parental leave from January 2026. This is a great opportunity for a result-oriented team player who prioritizes delivering value to users and has an interest in UX. The estimated start date is early December 2025.
   

  

 The client value curiosity, creativity, and collaboration. You’ll thrive if you enjoy sharing ideas, supporting colleagues, and driving initiatives forward together. You will contribute to both the technical and cultural strength of the team.
   

  

**About the Role**
 As a frontend developer in this team, you’ll work closely with experienced backend and frontend developers, as well as UX, Product, and Analytics colleagues, to shape innovative digital products. Your work will directly impact the experience for users on one of Sweden’s leading digital platforms.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain high-quality frontend solutions using Next.js.
* Collaborate in an agile development environment, contributing to sprints, planning, and reviews.
* Ensure the products you deliver are user-focused and scalable, working closely with UX and product teams.
* Support testing and quality assurance processes, including unit and integration testing.
* Contribute ideas and best practices to improve frontend architecture and workflows.


**Job requirements**
**To succeed in this role, we see that you have:**
* 2–3 years of professional experience as a frontend developer.
* Strong experience with Next.js
* Experience working in agile development teams.
* Based in or near Stockholm, able to work hybrid (office 3 days/week, 2 days remote).


**Meritorious experience:**
* Component libraries (Storybooks).
* Familiarity with Radix-ui.
* GraphQL.
* Jest for unit-tests.
* Playwright for integration tests.
* Amplitude for tracking and A/B-tests.
* Contentful CMS.


**Who You Are**
 You are a collaborative frontend developer who enjoys solving technical challenges while delivering user-focused solutions. You are curious, proactive, and thrive in an environment where you can influence both product and culture.
   

  

**Application procedure**
 A Maandag® recruiter will assess your application as soon as possible to determine whether you are suitable for an open position.
   

  

**About The Company**
 If you are a good match, we would like to receive a CV in WORD format with motivation why you fit this assignment, your availability and any scheduled holidays.
   

  

 Why Maandag Nordic? With us, you’ll get the chance to really put your ideas into action. We offer a work environment where you can grow and learn through hands-on experience - trying things out, making mistakes, and improving.
   

  

 For more than 35 years, Maandag® has been at the forefront of empowering people and organisations. We not only help professionals get jobs, but also connect them with a future that matches their values, desires and ambitions. Because when people are truly in the right place, they can develop themselves, fulfil their dreams and go to work with fresh energy every day. The energy and power released in the process is a catalyst for growth for companies. We started in the Netherlands, but now we also help professionals and organisations in Belgium, Poland, Dubai and Sweden. Our extensive knowledge of different markets, coupled with our wide network, enables us to make perfect matches quickly.

title: Software Engineer
description:
💻 Full Stack Developer – Java / React / Angular
 



  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm (Hybrid)
 



**Type:** 
 Permanent
 



  





 A leading financial and technology organisation in central Stockholm is expanding its in-house IT department and looking for a
 **Full Stack Developer** 
 with experience across both backend and frontend technologies.
 



  





 This is an opportunity to make a real impact, building high-performing, secure, and modern applications that power critical business functions across Sweden. You’ll join a collaborative environment that values innovation, clean code, and professional growth.
 



  





 💼 About the Role
 



 You’ll work closely with product and business teams to design, develop, and maintain local applications and integrations. From gathering requirements to writing robust, testable code, your work will directly shape key systems used across the organisation.
 



  





**Key responsibilities:** 



* Translate business requirements into scalable IT solutions
* Develop and maintain backend and frontend components
* Ensure code quality through reviews, testing, and automation
* Drive technical upgrades and new feature implementation
* Collaborate across teams to ensure seamless integration
* Contribute actively in agile ceremonies and continuous improvement



  





 🧠 About You
 



 You’re a hands-on developer with strong technical foundations and a problem-solving mindset. You enjoy working across multiple technologies and thrive in a collaborative environment where your ideas make a difference.
 



  





**Requirements:** 



* 5+ years of professional software development experience within a DevOps or agile environment
* Degree in Computer Science, IT, or a related field
* Proven backend experience with
 **Java (17+)**
* Frontend experience with
 **React** 
 and
 **Angular**
* Experience with relational databases such as
 **PostgreSQL** 
 or
 **Microsoft SQL**
* Solid understanding of enterprise-scale IT infrastructure
* Fluent in
 **English** 
 (Swedish is a strong plus)
* Must be based in Sweden and eligible to work without visa sponsorship



  





 💰 What’s on Offer
 


* Competitive salary based on experience
* 30 vacation days per year (option to buy/sell additional days)
* Non-contributory pension and profit-sharing scheme
* Comprehensive health, wellness, and insurance benefits
* Flexible hybrid setup and strong focus on work-life balance



  





 🚀 Why Join?
 



 Join a respected financial institution with a strong reputation for stability, innovation, and employee development. You’ll be part of a collaborative, forward-thinking team that values both technical excellence and personal growth.
 



  





 Interested in learning more?
 



  





 Apply today to discuss this opportunity and become part of a growing tech team in the heart of Stockholm.

title: Backend Developer (TypeScript / Node.js)
description:
Om Redeye
   

  

 Redeye är en innovativ investment banking-firma med en ledande marknadsposition inom aktieanalys, Corporate Finance och Corporate Broking inom Life Science och Technology. Våra klienter är snabbväxande framtidsföretag på den nordiska marknaden. Vår research utgår från en värdebaserad investeringsfilosofi och använder en unik ratingmodell. Redeye grundades 1999, är ett auktoriserat värdepappersbolag och står under Finansinspektionens tillsyn.
   

  

 Om Rollen
   

  

 Redeye söker en backend-utvecklare som vill vara med och bygga framtidens finansiella digitala produkter. I rollen kommer du att designa och utveckla skalbara backend-lösningar med Node.js och TypeScript. Du kommer att samarbeta tätt med vårt team för att kontinuerligt förbättra våra tekniska system och driva innovation inom fintech. Vi erbjuder dig chansen att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där dina tekniska färdigheter får verklig påverkan.
   

  

 Din profil
   

  

*Vi tror att du har:*
* Civilingenjörsexamen eller motsvarande inom datateknik, systemvetenskap eller liknande.
* 2–5 års erfarenhet som backend-utvecklare, gärna med fokus på Node.js och TypeScript.
* God förståelse för databaser (SQL och/eller NoSQL), datamodellering och API-design.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av molnplattformar (GCP, Azure eller AWS) och containerisering.
* Erfarenhet av GraphQL (gärna federerad)
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD, versionshantering och kodgranskning.
* Stark kompetens i TypeScript och Node.js.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga skalbara och underhållbara backend-lösningar.
* Gärna erfarenhet av fullstack-utveckling.
* Gärna erfarenhet av PHP (Symfony) då vi gör ett arbete att migrera bort från detta.
* Gärna erfarenhet av Go eller Rust.


 Personlighet och arbetssätt:
   

  

* Är självgående och trivs med ansvar
* Har en entreprenöriell ådra och gillar att bygga nytt
* Är drivande och tar initiativ
* Har ett genuint intresse för modern webbutveckling och teknik
* En stort intresse för AI och AI-driven utveckling (m.h.a. ex Claude Code, Cursor etc)
* (Bonus!) Har ett intresse för aktier och finans


 Teknikstack och verktyg
   

  

* TypeScript & Node.js
* GraphQL
* PostgreSQL
* Cloud (AWS, GCP eller Azure)
* CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions)
* Message Brokers (RabbitMQ)


 Vad du får (hard perks):
   

  

* Vinstdelningsprogram som fördelas bland medarbetare. Systemet är transparent och fördelningen bygger på våra bidrag till bolagets värderingar
* Tjänstepension via Avanza
* Möjlighet till löneväxling
* Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Friskvårdsbidrag på 5000 SEK per år.
* Gruppträning med Redeyes näringsfysiolog och PT
* Eget val av dator, mobil och tillbehör, som i regel byts ut vartannat år


 Vad vi erbjuder (soft perks):
   

  

* Hos Redeye tycker vi att det är viktigt med passion för ständig förbättring, något vi uppmuntrar på flera sätt. För den här rollen finns det en budget avsatt för utveckling. Den kan användas till inspirerande konferensresor, inköp av litteratur, online-/offlinekurser, vanliga utbildningar, certifieringar eller annat som vi kommer överens om. Vi har återkommande lunch and learns i teamet, och vi avsätter tid för lärande och experimenterande.
* Ljusa moderna kontor mitt i Stockholms City (nära Centralstationen och Hötorget)
* Vi är ett starkt värdebaserat företag,där värderingarna är en naturlig del i hur vi navigerar och driver vår verksamhet. På engelska beskriver vi dem som: We are different with a purpose, We stay hungry to improve, We play for the marathon. Om vi träffas, berättar vi mer om vad de betyder för oss
* Hälsa och träning är viktigt för oss och vi har en anställd näringsfysiolog och personlig tränare som hjälper oss med kostråd, träning och ergonomi.
* Hälsoutmaningar, och diverse sportaktiviteter så som padelturnering, finansloppet m.m.
* Konferensresor med samtliga anställda på firman. Tidigare resor har gått till bland annat Mallorca, Tokyo, Marrakech och Tanzania.


**Frilansare, konsultbolag eller outsourcing vänligt undanbedes. Denna annons är enbart för en anställning.
   

  

 Freelancers, consulting firms, or outsourcing companies are requested to not reach out, this ad is for a permanent employment only**
*Frågor?*
 Johan Berglind (Chief Technology Officer)
   

  

*johan.berglind@redeye.se*

title: Product Developer to New Development (1 year temporary position)
description:
**Job Description**
*We are looking for a Product Developer Accessories & FBB with a strategic mindset, a passion for fashion, and a collaborative spirit to join our Guest Design & Collabs team at New Development, H&M.*
**What You’ll Do**
 As a Product Developer in Guest Design & Collabs, you’ll be at the heart of some of H&M’s most exciting and influential projects. This role gives you the unique opportunity to work with renowned guest designers and creative teams, shaping collections that capture global attention and set new standards for fashion innovation. We are looking for a product developer who wants to be part of a team that is driven, inspires and contributes to work towards our brand building goals.
   

  

 In this position you will focus on developing accessories, shoes and bags. You’ll lead the component & development process—from the first spark of an idea to the final product—ensuring every detail reflects our commitment to quality, sustainability, and creativity. In this fast-paced, collaborative environment, your vision and expertise will help turn bold concepts into reality, making a real impact on our brand and our customers.
   

  

* Drive the component and product development process with a strategic and customer-centric approach
* Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to bring visionary collections to life
* Lead pre-season planning and in-season execution, taking full ownership of development timelines and activity plans to ensure price, quality and sustainability targets are met.
* Identify and fill gaps in the component library—both digital and physical—aligning with brand direction and project needs, while actively supporting knowledge sharing across teams and in the accessory department.
* Take ownership of sourcing, material selection, and sample handling
* Foster strong relationships with production offices, suppliers, and vendors
* Support, guide and coordinate design consultants for each collab and project
* Track KPIs and reflect on outcomes to continuously improve development processes


**Who You Are**
 To succeed in this role, we believe you have:
   

  

* A degree in textiles, product development, or a related field
* +5 years of relevant experience, within accessories, shoes and bags. High fashion and premium background are merited
* Strong technical and quality knowledge, with clear insight into how making processes affect product outcomes.
* A deep understanding of the product development process and production capabilities
* A strategic and proactive mindset with strong planning and organizational skills
* A passion for fashion, innovation, and sustainability
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills
* A flexible, solution-oriented approach and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
* Strong salesmanship and entrepreneurial mindset


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

 The New Development department’s mission is to strengthen our brand’s fashion credibility by creating industry-leading products, collaborations, and new business developments. Our Brand Building collections aim to deliver the most desirable and sustainable products, combining cutting-edge fashion with creativity. When we launch something, the world stops for a moment. New Development is a fast-paced, collaborative environment where innovation and constant improvement are at the core of everything we do.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Additional information:
   

  

 This is a temporary position starting in December, with placement in Stockholm. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application including CV as soon as possible. Interviews will be held continuously. (For internal applicants, please remember to initiate a dialogue with your manager before applying).
   

  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Benefits:
   

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
   

  

 Inclusion & Diversity:
   

  

 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organization. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Frontend Developer to Thermo-Calc Software
description:
If you’ve ever wished that your phone were lighter, a battery lasted longer, or your plane flight required less fuel for the environment, then you’ve wished for a better material. At
 **Thermo-Calc Software,** 
 we make software and databases that are used by materials scientists and engineers to generate data that helps them design better materials and improve materials processing conditions.
 



  





 Our flagship product, Thermo-Calc, is used by more than 1900 organizations located in more than 60 countries around the world to drive innovation through improved, advanced materials.
 



 Are you ready to create intuitive, modern user experiences for complex scientific tools? Thermo-Calc Software in Solna is looking for a skilled Frontend Developer (React) to join our passionate team in shaping the future of materials science software.
 



  





 We’re a fast-growing tech company at the intersection of engineering, research, and user-centered design. With customers around the globe and a product that truly makes a difference in research and industry, your frontend skills will directly contribute to innovation in materials development, sustainability, and beyond. Help us build the Future of Scientific Software!
 



  





 As Frontend Developer, you’ll take a leading role in developing the user interface for our next-generation web platform. Working in a cross-functional environment with backend developers, FORTRAN specialists, designers, and scientists, you’ll ensure that complex scientific workflows are transformed into elegant, user-friendly web applications.
 



  





 You’ll primarily work with React, TypeScript, and modern frameworks such as Fastify, alongside Spring Boot and Azure on the backend. Your focus will be on delivering robust, scalable, and visually intuitive frontends that meet high technical and usability standards.
 



  





**In this role, you will:** 




 Design and build dynamic, interactive web interfaces using React and TypeScript
 



 Collaborate with backend and scientific developers to integrate advanced functionality
 



 Maintain a high standard of UI performance, accessibility, and responsiveness
 



 Contribute to architectural decisions and continuous improvement processes
 



 Participate in code reviews and team discussions to maintain quality and consistency
 



 Stay updated on frontend trends, tools, and best practices
 



  





**Qualifications** 




 Strong experience with React and modern JavaScript/TypeScript frameworks
 



 Solid understanding of frontend architecture and state management (e.g. Redux, Context)
 



 Solid understanding of HTML5, CSS3, and modern CSS frameworks (e.g., SASS, Styled Components, Tailwind)
 



 Experience with REST APIs and integrating complex backend logic into the UI using tRPC
 



 Familiarity with version control systems like Git and Continuous Integration such as Jenkins
 



 Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset
 



 A degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
 



  





**Meritorious:** 




 Knowledge of backend tools like Java Spring Boot
 



 Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud)
 



 Exposure to containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes)
 



 Experience integrating scientific or numerical code into a GUI
 



 Agile development experience (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)

title: Senior .NET Developer
description:
**Senior .NET Developer | Stockholm | Azure & React** 




 Are you an experienced .NET developer who enjoys solving complex technical challenges and working across modern cloud-based solutions?
 



  





 We’re partnering with a
 **Stockholm-based consultancy** 
 known for delivering high-quality, high-impact projects for clients across multiple industries - many within finance and fintech. They’re now looking for a
 **Senior .NET Developer** 
 to join their team.
 



  





 This role requires working on-site in Stockholm with a hybrid working arrangement.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Work on end-to-end system development projects using
 **.NET** 
 ,
 **React** 
 , and
 **Azure Cloud** 
 .
* Collaborate with skilled developers and client teams to design and deliver modern, scalable solutions.
* Take ownership of your work - from architecture and implementation to deployment and optimisation.

**What We’re Looking For**

 in software development using

 .

 services.
