 We are reviewing applications on an ongoing basis. Feel free to reach out directly to t.collard-gentle@tenthrevolution.com with any questions.

title: Data Engineer
description:
The DataEx team is at the heart of data processing, scheduling, and orchestrating data workflows to run seamlessly. Like a heart that pumps blood, when something in the processing doesn’t work, it’s the heart that reveals the issue to our users. Historically, DataEx has managed the orchestration and scheduling of data pipelines while owning the developer data experience, which has led the team to be heavily involved in daily internal user support. This role requires a deep understanding of data pipelines, backend systems, and the unique data ecosystem. To enhance user support and streamline our processes, we’re looking for innovative solutions, such as AI tools and improved documentation, to enable self-service for common queries.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will possess a strong blend of data engineering and backend experience, coupled with a highly analytical approach and a user-focused mindset, showing genuine compassion for our internal developers whose productivity we aim to enhance. Creativity is essential for identifying and implementing solutions that provide both immediate and long-term support, ultimately reducing the team's ongoing burden.
   

  

 Main Responsibilities:
   

  

* Manage orchestration and scheduling of data pipelines.
* Provide daily internal user support for data workflow issues.
* Analyze backend systems for efficiency and performance.
* Develop innovative user support solutions using AI tools.
* Create documentation to enable self-service for common queries.


 Key Requirements:
   

  

* Strong data engineering skills.
* Proficient in backend development.
* Exceptional analytical abilities.
* User-focused mindset with empathy toward internal users.
* Experience in enhancing internal processes and workflows.
* Experience in Golang, Scala and Java


 Nice to Have:
   

  

* Familiarity with AI-driven tools.
* Experience in creating user documentation.
* Knowledge of data pipeline technologies.


 Other Details:
   

  

 Duration: From November 3, 2025, to April 6, 2026. This position is remote, allowing flexible work arrangements.

title: Embedded Developer
description:
At Sii Sweden we partner with some of the most forward-thinking companies across industries such as automotive, healthcare, life-science and banking.
   

  

 As an Embedded Software Developer at Sii, you won’t just write code—you’ll contribute to the success of diverse, high-impact projects that demand both deep technical knowledge and creative problem-solving; you’ll play a key role in delivering tailored solutions that meet client’s unique requirements.
   

  

 Joining us means working in a collaborative, consultancy-driven environment so If you're excited by challenge, and the opportunity to grow alongside some of the best engineers in the field, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

****Your tasks****
* Design and implement software architecture for embedded systems
* Develop robust applications using C++ and Qt/QML for device interfaces and control logic
* Work on hardware-related programming, including device drivers
* Design, build, and debug embedded Linux environments (GNU/Linux) for various hardware platforms
* Write scripts and tools in Python (or equivalent) to support development, testing, and automation
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, QA, and UX designers
* Contribute to design reviews, documentation, and system integration activities


**Requirements**
* Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or similar
* Solid experience with C++ in embedded system environments
* Strong knowledge of Qt/QML for UI and application layer development
* Experience with GNU/Linux system development and configuration
* Hands-on knowledge of hardware-level programming
* Familiarity with scripting in Python or a similar language
* Proficiency in embedded systems architecture and real-time constraints
* Ability to debug complex software/hardware interactions


 Job no. 250909-CD0I6
   

  

**Benefits For You**
 Solid financial situation
   

  

 Many experts you can learn from
   

  

 Contracts with the biggest brands
   

  

 Refferals program
   

  

 Mentoring program
   

  

 14 authentic core values
   

  

 Inclusive culture based on dialogue
   

  

 Regular integration events and trips
   

  

 Passion Sponsorship Program
   

  

 Open and accessible management team
   

  

 Profit sharing
   

  

 Welcome packs & occasional gifts

title: DevOps Software Engineer, Research and Development
description:
We are driving the evolution toward smart, sustainable, and connected factories. As part of this journey, we are looking for a DevOps Software Engineer to join our Infrastructure Office Team within the Station Critical Software Department, R&D.
   

  

 Our mission is to provide robust, secure, and efficient infrastructure and DevOps services that empower developers and testers across the department. If you are passionate about automation, scalability, and enabling cutting-edge software development, this is your opportunity to make a real impact.
   

  

 Your role
   

  

 You will be part of a dedicated DevOps team responsible for configuration management, infrastructure maintenance, and continuous integration/delivery pipelines. We embrace Open Source and Linux, and we maintain our entire DevOps stack on-premises in our own data center—giving us full control and independence from external cloud providers.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines and build systems for complex software products.
* Managing and improving our Kubernetes-based infrastructure and GitOps workflows.
* Automating deployment and configuration using tools like Helm, Puppet, and Argo CD.
* Implementing monitoring and telemetry solutions with Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, and the ELK stack.
* Supporting developers and testers by ensuring reliable, scalable, and secure infrastructure.
* Driving automation across the DevOps ecosystem with Python and Groovy for build services, pipeline orchestration, and infrastructure tasks.


 To succeed, you will need
   

  

* A university degree in a technical field, such as a Bachelor or Master of Science in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent
* Solid experience in DevOps practices and CI/CD pipeline development.
* Strong skills in Python for automation and build system development.
* Hands-on experience with container orchestration (Kubernetes) and GitOps workflows.
* A collaborative mindset and ability to support multiple development teams.
* Fluency in English; Swedish is a plus.


 In return, we offer
   

  

 At Atlas Copco, we foster a friendly atmosphere and a culture built on respectful interaction and ethical behavior. We value personal development and well-being, and we take pride in supporting each other.
   

  

**You’ll Have The Opportunity To**
* Work with cutting-edge technologies in a fully on-prem DevOps environment.
* See your ideas realized and make a real impact on mission-critical software.
* Collaborate with global teams and explore career opportunities across the Atlas Copco Group.


 Job location
   

  

 This role offers a hybrid working arrangement, allowing you to split your time between working remotely and being on-site in Stockholm, Sweden (SE).
   

  

**Uniting curious minds**
 Behind every innovative solution, there are people working together to transform the future. With careers sparked by initiative and lifelong learning, we unite curious minds, and you could be one of them.

title: Developer till Kleer
description:
**💛** 
**It all comes Kleer – vi söker utvecklare till våra utvecklingsteam!**
 Kleer (tidigare PE Accounting) grundades för att revolutionera ekonomi- och lönebranschen genom ledande teknik och ekonomiexpertis. Idag erbjuder vi marknadens mest automatiserade system med över 80% automationsgrad – men vi är långt ifrån klara.
   

  

 Vill du vara med på nästa steg i vår resa? Vi söker nu en självgående utvecklare som vill växa vidare i ett produktbolag där teknik och affär går hand i hand.
   

  

**🚀 Rollen hos oss**
 Som utvecklare på Kleer blir du en del av ett dedikerat och kunnigt team som varje dag gör skillnad – för våra användare och för vår produkt. Du arbetar fullstack med tyngd i Javabackend, i en kodbas där kvalitet och långsiktighet står i centrum.
   

  

**Hos Oss Kommer Du Att**
* Arbeta i hela utvecklingscykeln – från diskussion med produktägare till kod i produktion
* Bidra till teamets gemensamma leveranser och tekniska beslut
* Arbeta i en modern Java-stack och få möjlighet att prova nya tekniker
* Ha nära samarbete med produktägare och andra utvecklingsteam


**🛠️** 
**Tekniken vi använder**
**Vi Jobbar i Huvudsak Med**
* Java 19, Spring, Spring Boot
* MySQL
* gRPC, REST, Linux
* Microservices
* React och Typescript för frontend
* CI/CD via Jenkins, Git och Docker för en containerbaserad infrastruktur


 Vi jobbar testdrivet, med hög grad av automatiserade tester och tät releasecykel – kod släpps varje vecka. Vår kodbas är välvårdad, och vi uppgraderar regelbundet till de senaste versionerna av våra verktyg.
   

  

**👩‍💻** 
**Vem vi söker**
**Vi Tror Att Du**
* Har ca 3–6 års erfarenhet av utveckling i Java
* Är trygg i att arbeta självständigt i ett team – men också van att be om hjälp och ge stöd till andra
* Har en god förståelse för databaser och grundläggande webbteknik
* Är nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och gillar att förstå användarnas behov
* Talar och skriver svenska obehindrat


 Du behöver inte vara expert på allt – vi värderar inställning och vilja att växa högre än perfekta svar på kodtest.
   

  

**🧑‍🤝‍🧑** 
**Hur vi jobbar**
 Vi arbetar agilt i autonoma team som själva prioriterar utifrån affärsmål. Varje team ansvarar för en del av produkten, men i hela teknikstacken – vilket gör jobbet både varierat och meningsfullt.
   

  

 Du har stora möjligheter att påverka både hur vi jobbar och vad vi bygger. Vi gillar initiativ, transparens och att hjälpas åt. Just nu bygger vi också om delar av vår arkitektur – vilket innebär mycket lärande och chans att vara med från början i nya lösningar.
   

  

**🏢** 
**Kontor & flexibilitet**
 Vi har ett helt nytt, påkostat kontor på Fleminggatan 14 i centrala Stockholm – där vi möts för att samarbeta, spela pingis, skissa på whiteboards och ha retrospectives. Samtidigt vet vi att flexibilitet är viktigt, så du kan förstås också arbeta hybrid när det passar dig och teamet.
   

  

**💬** 
**Om Kleer**
 Vi är ett stabilt och värderingsstyrt produktbolag, grundat 2011, med ca 200 medarbetare i Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö. Vi växer organiskt med sunda finanser – och är sexfaldiga DI Gaseller.
   

  

 Vi drivs av att förändra hur företag jobbar med ekonomi och lön – och det gör vi med en kombination av teknik, engagemang och nytänkande. Läs mer om oss på vår karriärsida.
   

  

**Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller i slutskedet av våra rekryteringsprocesser.**
**Sökord:** 
 Java 19, Spring, Spring Boot, Docker, REST, Linux, MySQL, Microservices, IntelliJ, Jenkins, Git, Remix, React. Fullstack, Backend, Produktbolag.
   

  

 Vi på Kleer ändrar sättet världen ser på ekonomi- och lönehantering!
   

  

 Vårt automatiserade system, i kombination med vår tjänsteleverans bildar tillsammans en helhetslösning som ger våra kunder möjligheten att outsourca sin ekonomifunktion, och samtidigt behålla 100% kontroll - i realtid.
   

  

 Vi har en stabil affärsmodell, där över 90% av intäkterna är prenumerationsbaserade. Tillväxten har skett organiskt och med sunda finanser. Vi har fått utmärkelsen DI Gasell sex år i rad och är ett värderingsstyrt bolag med stort fokus på glädje, ansvar, prestigelöshet och nyfikenhet!

title: Android Developer
description:
**Why This Job Is for You**
 You want to be part of an engaged and collaborative team where you can deepen your expertise in software engineering, with focus on Android app development, while continuing to grow your technical knowledge. You enjoy contributing to meaningful product development for both startups, large-scale product companies, and public organizations alike.
   

  

 At DDX we put people at the heart of our process. We create digital products that improve everyday life — not just for today’s users, but for future generations, with a lasting impact on both people and the planet. We choose the right tech for the task – Android, iOS, or modern multiplatform frameworks like React Native and Kotlin Multiplatform. We value your curiosity and willingness to explore new technologies.
   

  

 You will be working within our Hardware & Design business area, where we combine broad engineering expertise with deep specialist knowledge and a user-centered approach – to develop physical products and digital experiences all the way from concept to large-scale production.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, build, and maintain digital products, primarily Android apps. Most often, in close collaboration and in joint contribution, with the corresponding iOS app.
* Collaborate closely with designers and backend developers to craft seamless, user-friendly solutions.
* Work with CI/CD pipelines to ensure continuous integration and high-quality delivery.
* Participate in architectural discussions and influence tech decisions and design patterns.
* Evaluate and implement new technologies and frameworks to enhance the development process and user experience.
* Contribute to a collaborative, knowledge-sharing culture. Help guide our clients by understanding their goals and suggesting solutions that create real value for them—and us.


**Qualifications**
* You are an experienced developer with solid knowledge of the Android SDK.
* You are comfortable with Kotlin or Java, and have worked with Android architectures such as MVI, MVP, or MVVM. Bonus if you’re familiar with Jetpack Compose.
* You understand and apply design patterns that help you write high-quality, clean, and maintainable code.
* You have experience with unit testing and working with CI/CD pipelines.
* You care about system architecture, usability, and interface design.
* You have worked with asynchronous and reactive programming, for example with RxJava or Kotlin coroutines/flow.
* You are used to working in an agile environment, collaborating closely with product owners, designers, developers, and testers.
* You are experienced in code reviews and collaboration in multidisciplinary teams.
* You thrive as a consultant — driven by curiosity for our clients’ business and needs, using your expertise to help them succeed and growing together with our team at Knightec Group.


**Meriting**
* Experience with iOS development (Swift), or with multiplatform frameworks such as React Native, Kotlin Multiplatform, or Flutter.
* Experience as web developer, frontend or fullstack.


**An exciting journey with Knightec Group**
 Semcon and Knightec have joined forces to become Knightec Group. Together, we are shaping Northern Europe’s leading strategic partner in product and digital service development – how cool is that?
   

  

 With a unique blend of cross-functional expertise and a holistic understanding of business, we help our clients realize their strategies – from idea to finished solution. At Knightec Group, you’ll find the skills, mindset, and drive needed to take on the most challenging and innovative projects.
   

  

 For our employees, this means incredible opportunities to help shape the future through meaningful projects at the very forefront of technology. Here, you’ll not only grow and develop, but also become part of something greater.
   

  

 Does this sound like the place for you? Join us on this exciting journey!
   

  

**Practical Information**
 This is a permanent position with a six-month probationary period. You’ll be based in our central Stockholm office, but we support hybrid and flexible work arrangements. The ideal start date is as soon as possible, or by agreement. Apply no later than 2025-11-30. If you have questions about the role, contact Mikael Westh, Talent Acquisition Specialist. Due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page. We’re looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Android Developer, Retail App, Solna/Hybrid
description:
We are building the essential Retail solutions used at thousands of servicepoints across the Nordics. By providing our network partners with the most intuitive and reliable tools on the market, we play an integral role in PostNord’s growth.
   

  

 Through user-centric mobile applications and serverless architecture, we enable millions of customer interactions every year. Our team proudly takes the lead on developing creative and scalable solutions to re-shape the user experience at our physical locations. We are now looking for an Android developer to join us on this journey!
   

  

 You are an Android developer with a passion for teamwork. While striving for optimisation and simplification, you tackle complex business requirements with technical practises and problem-solving skills.
   

  

 By leading with humility and curiosity, you also empower your fellow team members in their own technical development. You are used to the challenges that modern computing platforms bring such as asynchronous programming and are comfortable with the reactive programming paradigm.
   

  

* BSc degree in Engineering and minimum 3 years of work experience in Mobile development
* Significant experience programming for the Android platform, using Java and/or Kotlin
* Some experience in Jetpack Compose


**We offer you**
**Responsibilities**
 We offer a variety of work and a lot of freedom and empowerment in an international environment with constantly new challenges and quick decisions. Here you have opportunities and freedom to develop creative solutions and you will be able to switch responsibilities within the team as you see fit for your and the teams’ qualities and experiences. You will be hired by PostNord Sweden which is one of Sweden's largest workplaces and we offer safe employment conditions and benefits. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment. Watch the video about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
   

  

 We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless of whether we lead ourselves or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 What are you waiting for? Send in your application! Due to the summer holiday period, responses and follow-ups may take a bit longer than usual. We will be back after the vacation in August and look forward to reconnecting with you then. If you have any questions, feel free to contact manager malin.rydman@postnord.com.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Business Developer
description:
**Vill du bli med och bygga upp Axaz i Sverige? Bli en nyckelspelare i vårt svenska Core Team!**
**Introduktion**
 Axaz är en modern digitaliseringspartner - en katalysator för företag och organisationer i ständig förändring. Vår mission är att hjälpa våra kunder att skapa värde med data och teknologi, genom vår spetskompetens inom Enterprise Architecture, System integration, Data Insight & Warehousing, Applikationsutveckling, CRM, och AI.
   

  

 Vi utmanar traditionella IT- och konsultbolag med en agil och flexibel leveransmodell som fokuserar på resultat, inte bara fakturerade timmar. Detta har gjort oss till en eftertraktad partner för en bred kundbas som spänner över en rad olika branscher och storlekar.
   

  

 Sedan starten i Oslo, maj 2021, har resan varit en succé. Vi har organiskt vuxit från tre till 50+ anställda och blivit en betrodd digitaliseringspartner till över 80 företag i Norge. Bland våra kunder finns några av landets största och mest välkända varumärken, såsom ISS, Hertz och Volvo Cars. Efter att ha bevisat vår modell på den norska marknaden är vi nu redo för nästa kapitel: Sverige!
   

  

**Vi söker nu de allra första nyckelpersonerna som kommer att utgöra vårt svenska Core Team**
**Om rollen**
 Vi söker dig som brinner för goda kundrelationer, digitalisering och tillväxt, med erfarenhet från lösningsförsäljning, affärsutveckling eller managementkonsult-branschen.
   

  

 Som Business Developer blir du en central del av vårt nya svenska team och arbetar tätt ihop med VD och projektledare för att lägga grunden för vår framgång i Sverige. Du kommer att leda säljprocesser från start till slut och samarbeta nära våra första svenska kunder för att definiera och anpassa lösningar som möter deras unika affärsbehov.
   

  

 Du blir i tillägg en integrerad del av vårt framgångsrika norska säljteam. Genom dagligt digitalt samarbete och regelbundna resor till Oslo får du tillgång till expertisen från erfarna säljkollegor och specialister för att utveckla övertygande business cases och offerter. Samtidigt ges du stort ansvar och flexibilitet att arbeta självständigt och forma din egen roll. Detta ger dig den sällsynta möjligheten att bygga den nya svenska verksamheten från grunden, boostad med stödet från en etablerad organisation i ryggen.
   

  

**Det här är mer än ett jobb ...**
**Det är en chans att vara med och bygga något stort från dag ett**
**Som Business Developer kommer du bland annat att**
* Spela en nyckelroll i vår svenska expansion som en del av det svenska Core Team.
* Tillsammans med VD och projektledare, strategiskt bygga upp den svenska kundbasen från grunden.
* Leda och koordinera säljprocesser från A till Ö.
* Facilitera djupgående samtal och workshops med potentiella kunder och specialister från Axaz.
* Utveckla långsiktiga kundrelationer på operativ och strategisk nivå.
* Identifiera och omsätta kundbehov i konkreta offerter och kontrakt.


**Önskade kvalifikationer**
* Högre utbildning (kandidat- eller masterexamen) inom t.ex. ekonomi, teknologi, innovation eller affärsutveckling.
* Erfarenhet av lösningsförsäljning (B2B), gärna inom teknologi eller konsulttjänster, med goda resultat.
* Förmåga att utarbeta övertygande presentationer och offertdokumentation med PowerPoint/Slides.
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter på både svenska och engelska. Kunskaper i annat skandinaviskt språk är starkt meriterande.
* Erfarenhet av offentlig upphandling och/eller projektledning är meriterande.


**Meriterande system/teknologi-erfarenheter**
* CRM: Implementation eller integration av t.ex. Hubspot eller Salesforce
* ERP: Implementation eller integration av t.ex. Visma, SAP, Oracle, Business Central eller Dynamics
* IPaaS: Boomi, Workato, Google, Azure
* Dataplattform: Fabric, DataBricks, Snowflake, BigQuery
* Enterprise Architecture tools: Ardoq, Bizzdesign eller motsvarande


**Personliga egenskaper vi tror att du har**
* Kommersiellt och strategiskt tankesätt: Du ser möjligheter, förstår kundbehov och utvecklar lösningar som skapar värde.
* Relationsbyggare och lagspelare: Du trivs med människor, etablerar förtroende och samarbetar väl för att nå gemensamma mål.
* Analytisk och lösningsorienterad: Du ser helheten, identifierar utmaningar och omsätter dem i konkreta åtgärder.
* Initiativrik och självgående: Du tar ansvar, arbetar proaktivt och trivs i en dynamisk miljö där du får vara med och forma strukturerna.
* Tydlig och anpassningsbar kommunikatör: Du förmedlar idéer på ett engagerande sätt, oavsett målgrupp.


**Vi erbjuder**
* En unik möjlighet att vara med från start och forma både din egen roll och företagets framtid i Sverige som en del av det svenska Core teamet.
* Konkurrenskraftiga villkor, inklusive ett attraktivt incitaments- och aktieprogram, samt stora utvecklings- och karriärmöjligheter.
* En arbetsmiljö som främjar lärande genom kurser och certifieringar inom marknadsledande lösningar.
* En social och inkluderande kultur med regelbundna aktiviteter, bland annat årlig vinterresa, teamträffar och gemensamma evenemang i både Stockholm och Oslo.
* Moderna lokaler i centrala Stockholm med tillgång till ett toppmodernt gym.


**Rekryteringen sker löpande, så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan.**
**Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse, med sikte på Q1 2026.**

title: Senior Software Engineer to Mycronic!
description:
Mycronic is a global high-tech company whose innovative solutions have been advancing electronics technology for over 50 years. Today we continue to grow and serve customers in an expanding variety of industries. What we do impacts the future of technology, and in turn, the way we live our lives tomorrow. We’re looking for people to join our talented, motivated and friendly team on the cutting-edge. Here, in an open, collaborative and flexible environment, you’ll work alongside leading industry experts and take on challenging projects that bring tomorrow’s electronics to life. If you have several years of work experience within software development and embedded systems and wants to be part of a growing company with world leading products, this is for you!
 



  





 About the role
 



 Mycronic has experienced strong growth in recent years, both organically and through acquisitions. With headquarters in Sweden, Mycronic is a global organization with subsidiaries, agents, and distributors in over 50 countries. Mycronic is divided into four divisions, and in this role, you will belong to PCB Assembly Solutions (PA). PA is a leading provider of equipment and solutions for surface mount technology (SMT) to electronics manufacturers who require rapid production adjustments while maintaining high efficiency. PA delivers systems for circuit board assembly, including both complete line solutions and individual systems for specific process steps, as well as advanced software for assembly process management and connected factories. In this role, you will be part of a team of 7 team members and collaborate with several functions across the company, such as architects, project managers and other software teams within for example AI.
 



  





**Some words from your future manager** 




*"I have worked at Mycronic for over 25 years which is a long time in the modern world, and I am still excited to go to work. What has kept me here so long is the opportunity to work with complex and interesting technology and fantastic colleagues here is Sweden and around the world. An important factor for me has also been that the company is large enough so that we can tackle complex problems that includes many different areas of technology, yet small enough for you to have an insight to several technology areas and make a key contribution to the development of the products."* 




  





**You are offered** 



* The opportunity to work in a multi-cultural company with knowledgeable, friendly and goal-oriented colleagues.
* To work in an exciting company in a growth phase, where you can make a real impact in a fun and dynamic environment. Mycronic is a global company, yet small enough for you to truly make a difference.
* The opportunity to work with world-leading products. The future of electronics production is increasingly complex. Denser boards, a wider range of miniaturized components, more NPIs and erratic production schedules. To address these challenges Mycronic has developed the industry’s fastest, most flexible and most precise jet printing and solder paste dispensing systems. Mycronic jet printing technology makes it possible to dispense solder paste for the most challenging circuit boards and components, with micrometer accuracy, maximum speed and perfect quality solder joints.
 *HERE.*
* Mycronic has a large software organization which will provide you with optimal opportunities to develop your knowledge in various areas of computer science – such as software architecture for robotics, machine learning, AI, optimization, and computer vision.



  





 Work tasks
 



 You will work in a broad developer role where you will truly have the opportunity to influence the final solution of the products. The Mycronic Jet Printer, which is the product area you will be developing the software for, includes electronics, mechanics, and software, creating exciting opportunities for those who want to work with complex software development involving multiple technical disciplines.
 



  





 We are continuously working to enhance our products' user-friendliness, particularly in terms of automation and user interfaces, which will also be part of your development work. Your primary focus will be on improving the products, with opportunities to contribute your ideas and collaborate as a team to create the best solutions. This may involve anything from adding capability features and reducing energy consumption to updating the GUI. Mycronic has both R&D, lab, and production in-house, meaning you will work close to the products you develop, which also gives you the opportunity to see the "real-world" results of your work.
 



  





 We are looking for
 



 This is a role for you who wants to be a key player in product development, where all technology comes together to create user-facing functionality. As a software developer, you’ll work across the whole process – from requirements and design to architecture and development – in close collaboration with multiple stakeholders. As a person, we see it as particularly important that you are goal- and detail-oriented and have strong collaboration skills. You also have a will to contribute with your ideas, and just like your colleagues, you always strive to develop yourself and contribute to the team's collective growth.
 


* A bachelors- or master´s degree within computer science, electronics, mechatronics or similar
* Several years of work experience with software development, prefereably with systems that include hardware
* Strong knowledge in Java
* Strong knowledge of software development in Linux
* Strong good knowledge in English and good knowledge in Swedish (or have the desire to learn)



  





 It is considered advantageous if you have...
 


* Knowledge in C and/or C++



  





**Other Information** 



* Start date: By agreement · Employment type: Permanent
* Scope: Full-time
* Location: Täby/Kista – Mycronic plans to move its office and production to Kista at the end of 2025.
* Contact Information: Senior Recruitment Consultant Johanna Sörell, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se, and Recruitment Coordinator Minna Loosaar, minna.loosaar@academicwork.se.
* The recruitment process is handled by Academic Work, and Mycronic requests that all questions regarding the process goes to Academic Work.



  





 Our recruitment process
 


* Phone interview with Academic Work
* Problem-solving and personality test
* In-depth interview with Academic Work
* Interviews with Mycronic
* Reference check + decision



  





 Mycronic AB (publ)
 



 Read more about Mycronic on their website: https://www.mycronic.com/

title: Back End Staff Software Engineer (Bangkok based, Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose -** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team**
 In Agoda’s Back-End Engineering department, we build scalable, fault-tolerant systems and APIs that host our core business logic. Our systems cover all major areas of our business: inventory and pricing, product information, customer data, communications, partner data, booking systems, payments, and more. We employ state-of-the-art CI/CD and testing techniques to ensure everything works without downtime. Our systems are self-healing, responding gracefully to extreme loads or unexpected input. We use modern languages like Kotlin and Scala, Data technologies Kafka, Spark, MLflow, Kubeflow, VastStorage, StarRocks and agile development practices. Most importantly, we hire great people from around the world and empower them to be successful.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Agoda Platform team is looking for developers to work on mission-critical systems that serve millions of users daily. You will have the chance to work on innovative projects, using cutting-edge technologies, and make a significant impact on our business and the travel industry.
   

  

**What You’ll Need To Succeed**
* 10+ years of experience developing performance-critical applications in a production environment using Scala, Java, Kotlin, C#, Go or relevant modern programming languages.
* Strong RDBMS knowledge (SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, or other).
* Ability to direct significant company-wide projects and sets technical vision.
* Good command of the English language.
* Deeply involved in making architectural decisions, setting the standard and direction for the team.
* Implement advanced CI/CD pipelines and robust testing strategies to ensure seamless integration, deployment, and high code quality.
* Passion for software development and continuous improvement of your knowledge and skills.


**It’s Great if You Have**
* Knowledge in NoSQL, Queueing systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, MSMQ), and Play framework.


**This position is based in Bangkok, Thailand (Relocation Provided)**
 #Bengaluru #Hyderabad #Gurgaon #SouthKorea #Berlin #London #Pakistan #Pune #SanFrancisco #SanJose #Seattle #TelAviv #Jakarta #Colombia #NewYork #Vietnam #Russia #Madrid #SaoPaulo #Noida #Toronto #Chennai #Singapore #Ukraine #UAE #Sunnyvale #BuenosAires #Austin #Barcelona #Nigeria #Mumbai #Paris #Egypt #Stockholm #Amsterdam #Romania #Serbia #NewDelhi #MountainView #Chile #Warsaw #Sydney #Bangladesh #Peru #SantaClara #Chicago #Gurgaon #Munich #Montreal #Bangkok #Tallinn #Vilnius #Riga #Dublin #IT #ENG #5
   

  

**Discover More About Working At Agoda**
* Agoda Careers https://careersatagoda.com
* Facebook https://www.facebook.com/agodacareers/
* LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/agoda
* YouTube https://www.youtube.com/agodalife


**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Android
description:
**About Applied Intuition**
 Applied Intuition is the vehicle intelligence company that accelerates the global adoption of safe, AI-driven machines. Founded in 2017 and now valued at $15 billion following its recent Series F funding round, Applied Intuition delivers the Vehicle OS, Self-Driving System, and toolchain to help customers build intelligent vehicles and shorten time to market. 18 of the top 20 global automakers and major programs across the Department of Defense trust Applied Intuition's solutions to deliver vehicle intelligence. Applied Intuition services the automotive, defense, trucking, construction, mining, and agriculture industries and is headquartered in Mountain View, CA, with offices in Washington, D.C., San Diego, CA, Ft. Walton Beach, FL, Ann Arbor, MI, London, Stuttgart, Munich, Stockholm, Bangalore, Seoul, and Tokyo. Learn more at applied.co.
   

  

*We are an in-office company, and our expectation is that employees primarily work from their Applied Intuition office 5 days a week. However, we also recognize the importance of flexibility and trust our employees to manage their schedules responsibly. This may include occasional remote work, starting the day with morning meetings from home before heading to the office, or leaving earlier when needed to accommodate family commitments. (Note: For EpiSci job openings, fully remote work will be considered by exception.)*
**Meet our engineers on the Vehicle OS team!**
 Vehicle OS is a flexible suite of products that help vehicle manufacturers develop, deploy, and update complete vehicle software and AI applications. Learn more about what the team is building, the team culture, and why it’s one of the most exciting projects at Applied Intuition.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for bright engineers interested in designing elegant solutions to difficult problems in the autonomy space. Our software engineers work across our suite of products, tackling difficult full-stack, infrastructure, robotics, and graphics problems. At Applied Intuition, we encourage engineers to take ownership over technical and product decisions, interact closely with users to collect feedback, and contribute to a thoughtful, dynamic team culture.
   

  

 At Applied Intuition, you will:
   

  

* Work across our entire stack to develop new products, features, and tools
* Have an unparalleled opportunity to work with domain experts across a variety of fields: infrastructure, robotics, and graphics engineers, as well as startup veterans
* Carve out your own area of expertise and influence product decisions
* Collaborate with other members in the autonomy ecosystem and learn about different approaches to solving core issues in autonomy


 We're looking for someone who has:
   

  

* Experience shipping complex software and writing production code
* Demonstrated ability to be a self-starter and can quickly become comfortable with new technical tools
* Designed efficient and effective solutions to a wide range of engineering challenges
* Ability to take initiative in a fast-paced environment


 Nice to have:
   

  

* Working knowledge of frontend, API layer, containerization, or cluster orchestration frameworks (such as React, GraphQL, Docker, or Kubernetes)
* Experience in Android AOSP
* Experience writing Python, C++, or Java


*Don’t meet every single requirement? If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.*
*Applied Intuition is an equal opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor. Consequently, the parties agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and that these laws are incorporated herein by reference. These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. The parties also agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of Executive Order 13496 (29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A), relating to the notice of employee rights under federal labor laws.*

title: Account Manager / Business Developer
description:
**Position Summary:** 




  





 The Account Manager is responsible for developing new business relationships and serving as the first level of support to existing B2B clients.
 



  





**Position responsibilities:** 




  




* Develop an effective understanding of the capability, benefits and competitive advantages of TransPerfect’s services
* Identify prospective customers and individual organizations to focus on sales activities
* Develop new client relationships via cold calling, Internet, and trade shows
* In coordination with Sales Management, identify, qualify, develop and close sales opportunities
* Promote and educate clients regarding TransPerfect’s services
* Provide customer support and manage client expectations in liaison with the Production Management Team
* Manage and control pricing and contractual issues by developing a thorough understanding of company procedures
* Take an active role in learning about each client’s industry, business needs and company culture to identify new business opportunities and provide a high level of service
* Perform other special projects or duties when required



  





  





**Required skills, experience and qualifications:** 




  




* Interest in or previous experience in Strategic Business Development and/or Client Services/Account Management
* Ability to build and maintain relationships
* Superior written and spoken communication skills in English and Swedish
* Good analytical skills needed to project revenues, monitor budgets and other necessary calculations
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
* Minimum Bachelor’s Degree or its equivalent
* Ability to commute to our Stockholm office
 **5 days per week.**
* Most importantly, the ideal candidate must demonstrate ability to: multitask in a fast-paced environment, work well with people from a variety of different backgrounds and cultures, build strategic relationships with clients and co-workers, work as part of a team, take active measures to solve problems and commit to a high level of service



  





**Desired skills and experience:** 




  




* Previous Account Management experience is beneficial



  





 By applying, I confirm I have read and accept TransPerfect's Privacy Policy: https://www.transperfect.com/about/data-privacy-recruiting

title: Är du en fullstackutvecklare med ambition att växa mot en leadroll?
description:
Hos Visionera får du möjlighet att kombinera utveckling med tekniskt ledarskap. Vi söker en driven fullstackutvecklare med starkt teknikintresse som på sikt vill växa in i rollen som Lead Developer eller Tech Lead. Här får du arbeta brett i hela teknikstacken, från arkitektur till drift, tillsammans med kollegor som brinner för utveckling, innovation och ständig förbättring.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Som fullstackutvecklare hos Visionera blir du en del av vårt DevOps-team som utvecklar och förvaltar vår egna SaaS-lösning
 *VisionFlow -* 
 som är ett omfattande verktyg för projekt-, ärende- och kundhantering som används av kunder i både privat och offentlig sektor. Du kommer att arbeta med Java, JavaScript, databaser, infrastruktur och plattform. Med tiden kommer du att få ta mer ansvar för teknikval, arkitektur och utveckling. För rätt person finns en tydlig väg mot en mer ledande roll där du blir central i att forma både produkt och team.
 



*”På Visionera bygger vi produkter som gör verklig skillnad, och vi gör det tillsammans. Som fullstackutvecklare får du stort ansvar, direkt påverkan och möjlighet att jobba med moderna tekniker i ett team där idéer snabbt blir verklighet. Du kommer att arbeta med kunniga och engagerade kollegor som brinner för kodkvalitet, smarta lösningar och att ligga i teknisk framkant. Vi tror på transparens, nyfikenhet och att utvecklas kontinuerligt, både som bolag och individer.”* 
*– Jonas Fagerström, VD & grundare* 




  





**Du erbjuds** 



* 6 veckors semester
* Pensionstillägg på 7 % utöver lön
* Friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr/år
* Mobiltelefon med abonnemang för tjänst och privat bruk
* Möjlighet till 1 dag/vecka på distans
* En kultur som präglas av teknikintresse, prestigelöshet och innovation



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 



* Hands-on fullstack utveckling; mobilapp, webbklient, back-end och databas
* Vara delaktig i arbete med infrastruktur och applikationsdrift
* Delta i utveckling av nya moduler och förbättringar av produkten
* Agera bollplank till produktägare, testteam och support i tekniska frågor
* Samarbeta nära med kunder och bidra till teknisk problemlösning
* Dela ansvar för support (var 5–6:e dag) och beredskap (var 5–6:e vecka)



  





**Vi söker dig som** 



* Har en civilingenjörsubildning eller motsvarande
* Har stor bredd och djup inom Javautveckling och objektorienterad JavaScript
* Kunskap inom HTML, CSS, REST, SQL och databaser som MS SQL Server eller MySQL
* Erfarenhet av Windows, Linux och Git
* Kunskap om säkerhet, arkitektur och systemdesign
* Intresse för att bygga och utveckla AI-funktioner och effektiva lösningar
* Tycker om att ha kundkontakt
* Flytande i svenska och engelska då båda språken används i arbetet



  





**Det är meriterande om du har** 



* Kunskap om andra programmeringsspråk, utvecklingsmiljöer, ramverk och verktyg
* Erfarenhet av AI-teknik eller användning av AI i utvecklingsprojekt
* Erfarenhet av agila metoder och/eller leda en grupp/team
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta enligt DevOps-principer, inklusive testautomatisering, CI/CD och hantering av molntjänster
* Erfarenhet av eventdriven arkitektur, mikrotjänster och system med hög transaktionstäthet



  





**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:** 



* Självgående
* Problemlösande
* Kommunikativ
* Orädd
* Flexibel

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
```html
 



**About the Company** 




  





  





 At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it. FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day.
 



  





  





 We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field. Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?
 



  





  





**About the Role** 




  





  





 We are seeking a passionate and forward-thinking Senior DevOps Engineer to join our team in a fast-paced, technically challenging environment. In this role, you'll play a crucial part in building a fully automated platform by overseeing Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools, implementing and managing automation, and enhancing our Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) offerings. Your focus will be on establishing our Golden Path: developing best practices, guidelines, and recommendations around architecture, tooling, testing, compliance, and observability. You'll also streamline development cycles and reduce time-to-market for customer-facing services through automation, all while adopting a zero-downtime approach to maintain the stability and reliability of our operations. You will also get the chance to design, build and operate agentic pipelines and LLM-driven workflows. Implementing orchestration, reliability, guardrails, observability and cost controls for production agent workflows using tools like LangChain, n8n and vector databases. If you're eager to drive innovation and make a significant impact, this is your opportunity to shine. As a listed and regulated company, Kindred Group pays great attention to player safety and sustainability. Our purpose is to transform gambling by being a trusted source of entertainment that contributes positively to society. Our goal is that 0% of revenue is derived from harmful gambling.
 



  





  





**Responsibilities** 




  





  




* Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD pipelines.
* Design and implement Agentic workflows that chain prompts, RAG and external API's to complete multi-step tasks.
* Build and maintain integrations with LLM providers (OpenAi, Anthropic etc.).
* Define and support the creation of services and ensure the alignment among engineering teams.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate DevOps practices seamlessly into the development lifecycle.
* Enhance platform scalability, reliability, and security in on-premises and cloud environments.
* Advocate for DevOps best practices, promoting a culture of automation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
* Ability to identify and analyze incidents, develop and implement solutions.
* Stay up to date with emerging tools, trends, and technologies, and share knowledge within the team.
* Have the patience and ability as a subject matter expert to communicate with a wide variety of stakeholders.
* Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role.
* Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you.
* Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.



  





  





**Qualifications** 




  





  




* Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer or Developer.
* Experience of designing and building reusable CI/CD pipelines using industry standard tools such as Jenkins, Github, GitLab, Bitbucket Pipelines and ArgoCD.
* Experience with container orchestration systems such as Kubernetes and working in a dynamic containerised environment.
* Expertise in building services in Java and Spring frameworks.
* Expertise in microservice architecture.
* Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to foster partnerships and drive cross-functional alignment.



  





  





**Our Way Of Working** 




  





  





 Our world is hybrid. A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.
 



  





  





**Application Process** 




  





  





 We believe talent knows no boundaries. Our hiring process focuses solely on your skills, experience, and potential to contribute to our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and evaluate each candidate based on merit, regardless of personal characteristics as the age, gender, origin, religion, sexual orientation, neurodiversity or disability.
 



  





  





**Equal Opportunity Statement** 




  





  





 We are committed to diversity and inclusivity.
 



  





 ```

title: Project Manager
description:
At Stratsys, we offer a SaaS platform that streamlines compliance within business-critical areas such as sustainability, GRC and quality management. Unlike other compliance tools, we take it one step further by moving organizations from reporting to action and effectively distributing responsibilities internally.
   

  

 We are looking for a Project Manager to join our team in either Gothenburg or Stockholm. In this role, you will work with customers primarily within the public sector. As a Project Manager, you play a crucial role in ensuring that our customers get the most out of our products by guiding them through the onboarding process. Your goal is to make sure our customers effectively adopt and use our products to their full potential.
   

  

**WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?** 
**💡**
* An engaging work environment with people who share a common mindset to deliver a world-class product in important and impactful areas.
* Work within an important and well-established field where we have a strong reputation. The public sector is a central focus for us, with a well-developed pipeline and significant marketing support.
* Challenging, varied and engaging work tasks with room and encouragement for independence and innovation.
* Join a high-energy, close-knit team where every success is celebrated together. Please look at our Instagram to get an insight into our culture.
* Work from a fantastic and centrally located office at A House the Ark in Stockholm or at Kungsportsplatsen in Gothenburg.
* Be part of a company with great benefits – read more about our benefits here!


**About The Role  📌**
 As a Project Manager, your focus is to help our customers in their use of Stratsys cloud-based platform with associated products. You will primarily work towards the public sector and healthcare/schools. Some projects might also be towards the private sector where you meet customers in all industries.
   

  

 Our customers are mainly larger organizations where your contact areas span between people at the management and operational level. The projects often aim to implement and onboard new customers in one of our products or to support existing customers who have made a change or are to implement a new product. Your responsibilities include providing consultation, strategic advice, product customization, and training to our customers.
   

  

**Among your key responsibilities are:**
* Run and take ownership of product onboarding projects for our customers in collaboration with your colleagues
* Lead and motivate the customers project team through the implementation
* Independently conduct product training for customers, both digitally and physically
* Implement configurations based on customer needs, which means adjustments to the user interface in the product
* Consult the customer on how the products best fit with their processes and how to get full value out of the products
* Capture and follow up on the customer's further needs within our product offering to contribute to additional sales with our customers
* Collaborating with internal teams such as Customer Success and Product Sales to ensure the best possible results for the customers
* Provide smaller consulting services for customers, supporting them in continuous improvements and process optimization


**YOUR BACKGROUND** 
**✔** 
**️**
* A university degree in Business Administration, Systems Science, Behavioural Science, or a related field.
* Fluency in Swedish and strong proficiency in English.
* Previous experience from the public sector — preferably within a municipality or region.
* Experience from both relationship-oriented and strategic/operational roles, such as Business Developer, Quality Developer, Strategist within Education, or Project Manager in municipal development.
* Proven experience working with digital systems and a strong interest in driving your work through digital tools and platforms.


**Bonus Qualifications:**
* It's a bonus if you have worked in a similar role at a SaaS company
* It's also a bonus if you worked in or towards the school or healthcare sector


**About You 👀**
 To thrive in the of Project Manager, you are a team player with a genuine interest in both digitization and business management. As our platform consists of many different products, you need to have patience and a genuine interest in technical systems. You are fearless, have a positive and non-prestige attitude, and appreciate efficient collaboration. You thrive in a sales-driven organization and like to run your work independently. You take a lot of personal responsibility, which means that a dynamic environment where the weeks look different suits you perfectly.
   

  

**About Us 🚀**
 Does this look like a role for you? Do not hesitate, show your interest today since we are working ongoing with selection of candidates.
   

  

 Is this particular role not quite right for you -  Show your interest for future openings by connecting with us. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Do you want to read more about us and your future colleagues and take part in our everyday life here at Stratsys? Go to jobs.stratsys.com or follow us on LinkedIn or Instagram.

title: Lead iOS Developer
description:
Ready to take the lead in shaping world-class mobile experiences? NoA Ignite, a leading design and technology company within The North Alliance, is looking for a Lead iOS Developer to join our team.
 



  





 At NoA Ignite, we’re building the future of experience-led growth. We unite user-centric design, business strategy, AI, and deep-tech integrations into one seamless offer. With teams across Sweden, Denmark, Norway, and Poland, we deliver meaningful and measurable results for our clients.
 



  





 You’ll be part of our mobile engineering team, working on fintech and digital banking products that help millions of users manage their finances with confidence and simplicity.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As a Lead iOS Developer, you’ll take a key role in designing, building, and evolving large-scale iOS applications that solve real business challenges. You’ll:
 



  




* Lead technical direction, architecture, and best practices for iOS development
* Guide senior and junior engineers, ensuring quality and consistency across deliveries
* Translate complex business requirements into elegant, maintainable code
* Work hands-on with Swift and modern iOS frameworks throughout the full lifecycle — from architecture to testing and deployment
* Collaborate closely with designers, product managers, and backend developers to build reliable, high-performing solutions



  





 You’ll participate in governance and steering forums, communicating progress, technical challenges, and solution proposals clearly and confidently - bridging the gap between engineering and business stakeholders.
 



  





**What we’re looking for** 




 We’re seeking an experienced iOS engineer who enjoys leading teams, mentoring others, and shaping both technology and collaboration.
 



  





**You bring:** 



* 10+ years of experience in iOS development, with deep experience in Swift and modern frameworks
* Broad knowledge across the software engineering lifecycle — requirements, architecture, development, testing, integration, and deployment
* A track record of guiding teams, setting direction, and ensuring technical excellence
* Clear communication skills with the ability to represent technical work in business contexts
* Experience with Git, agile methodologies, and collaborative product development



  





**We also value if you:** 



* Have experience leading or mentoring developers — and are open to taking on managerial responsibility within NoA Ignite if the fit is right
* Have worked on complex or regulated products, such as within finance, banking, or security



  





**Why NoA Ignite** 




 Joining NoA Ignite means becoming part of a team that blends strategy, design, and technology to create remarkable digital experiences. We’re the tech-and-design powerhouse that turns complexity into effortless user journeys, unlocks data through smart AI, and builds what customers touch and businesses run on.
 



  





 You’ll work alongside talented colleagues across disciplines and borders - and help craft digital solutions that truly make an impact.

title: Finnish speaking Business Developer
description:
**🚀 Why BrightAnalytics?**
 BrightAnalytics is one of the fastest growing Fintech companies in Belgium. With our SaaS solution, we help companies automate their management reporting. As part of our European expansion, we are looking for motivated colleagues to join our team at our Stockholm office. Based in Sweden, you will contribute to the growth of the Finnish market. You’ll have the opportunity to grow and shape the future of the company in the Nordics.
   

  

**💡 What does a Business Developer do?**
* You understand the requirements and needs of our prospects and introduce them to the BrightAnalytics narrative
* Mapping out business opportunities through targeted segmentation
* You expand the number of incoming leads for our Account Executives by setting up targeted sales actions (outbound sales activities, social selling, trade shows, seminars)
* Always looking for new and creative ways of increasing our name awareness
* This position is the ideal springboard to a successful B2B sales career!


**💼 Who are you?**
* Holding a master’s degree, preferably in an economic area. Prior work experience is not a must
* Fluency in Finnish is essential due to the platform’s complexity, and fluency in English is a must in our international environment, fluency in Swedish is an advantage!
* Getting energized from your communication with potential customers and from the discovery and development of business opportunities
* You have the motivation and self-reliance required to fulfill this pivotal role
* Curiosity to learning new things every day
* As part of the team you are not afraid to go the extra mile
* Comfortable in a rapidly evolving environment
* Strong interest in business, finance and new technologies


**✨ What can you expect from us?**
* You will be part of a driven, dynamic and enthusiastic team in a varied job
* Weekly internal training sessions and on-the-job coaching will teach you unique skills that will serve you well throughout your career
* We are a financially healthy scale-up with international growth ambitions
* We have an open business culture with room for personal initiative
* You will receive a competitive salary with a motivating bonus system
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Pension Plan
* Insurance (sickness, pension, TGL, TFA)
* Friday after-work drinks, legendary team-buildings, and an annual weekend with the entire BrightAnalytics team


**Ready to boost your career?**
**Apply today and grow with BrightAnalytics!**

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability.
* Listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.


**We in the Infrastructure team** 
 are the backbone of Truecaller's success, providing a reliable, scalable, and secure platform that powers all our services and products. We are committed to delivering world-class internal and customer-facing infrastructure that drives innovation, minimizes operational friction for engineers, and ensures high availability.
   

  

**As a Senior Product Manager** 
 , you will be responsible for defining the vision, strategy, and roadmap for key areas within our core infrastructure platform. This role is highly cross-functional, requiring a deep understanding of infrastructure technologies, developer needs, and business objectives. The ideal candidate will transform complex technical challenges into clear, actionable product initiatives that deliver outsized value to our engineering organization and, ultimately, our customers.
   

  

**The Impact You Will Create**
* Strategy & Vision:
* Define the Product Strategy: Develop and articulate a compelling, long-term product vision and strategy for your domain (e.g., Cloud Platform, Observability, Compute, or Developer Experience).
* Roadmap Ownership: Own, prioritize, and manage the infrastructure product roadmap, balancing immediate engineering needs with future strategic investments.
* Business Justification: Build robust business cases (ROI, TCO, engineering velocity impact) to justify new infrastructure investments and features.
* Stakeholder Management & Execution:
* Customer Empathy: Act as the voice of the internal engineering customer, deeply understanding their pain points, workflows, and technical requirements related to infrastructure consumption.
* Cross-Functional Alignment: Work closely with Infrastructure Engineering, SRE (Site Reliability Engineering), Security, and Finance teams to ensure alignment on priorities and successful feature delivery.
* Product Definition: Write clear, concise, and detailed product requirements (PRDs, user stories) for new features and platform improvements.
* Go-to-Market (Internal): Develop and execute internal rollout plans, documentation, and training to drive adoption of new infrastructure services across the engineering organization.
* Measurement & Optimization:
* Define Success Metrics: Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics (e.g., reliability, adoption rate, TCO, engineering velocity improvements) to track the success and health of the infrastructure products.
* Iterative Improvement: Use data and feedback to constantly evaluate platform performance and guide continuous iteration and optimization.


**What You Bring In**
* Experience: 5+ years of product management experience, with at least 2-3 years directly managing core infrastructure, platform, or developer-facing tools.
* Technical Domain Knowledge: Strong understanding of at least one major infrastructure area (e.g., Public Cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure), Containerization (Kubernetes, Docker), Observability (Prometheus, Grafana, Jaeger), CI/CD, or Networking).
* Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear, concise language for technical and executive audiences.
* Analytical Skills: Proven ability to use data and quantitative analysis to inform product prioritization and decision-making.
* Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field is preferred, or equivalent practical experience.


**It Would Be Great If You Also Have**
* Strategic Thinker: Ability to think several years ahead and identify disruptive opportunities and threats in the infrastructure landscape.
* Influencer: Proven ability to influence change without direct authority across engineering teams and senior leadership.
* Bias for Action: Results-oriented with a proven track record of shipping complex infrastructure products.
* Experience working in a high-scale, fast-paced technology environment.
* Familiarity with DevOps and SRE principles and methodologies.


 Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/
   

  

**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
**We only accept applications in English.**
**What We Offer**
* A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget range.
* Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!


**Come As You Are**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.
   

  

 Job info
   

  

 Location
   

  

**Stockholm, Sverige**
 Category
   

  

**Product**
 Team
   

  

**Infrastructure**
 Posted
   

  

**today**

title: SAP Sales Distribution Specialist
description:
*We are currently looking for a SAP SD/LE Specialist to an exciting opportunity with our client Samsung!* 




  





  





**Help Us Create What Can’t Be Done** 




  





 Everything we do at Samsung is driven by an unyielding passion for excellence and an unfaltering commitment to developing the best products and services on the market. In today’s fast-paced global economy, change is constant and innovation is critical to a company’s survival. As we have done for 80 years, we set our sights on the future, anticipating market needs and demands so we can steer our company toward long-term success. As an SAP EDI developer, you will have an integral part in ensuring we stay on top of the market and continue to enrich and simplify the consumers’ lives.
 



  





**Why join our team? / A message from our team!** 




  





 If you are interested in SAP EDI/SD/LE and want to join a team that supports it, there are several compelling reasons why you should consider joining this team:
 



  




* Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology:



 We offer an exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge SAP technology in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. As part of our team, you'll be at the forefront of digital transformation, leveraging SAP SD/LE solutions integrated with EDI to optimize supply chain, Online Store, and logistics operations.
 



 We continuously invest in the latest advancements in AI, automation, and cloud-based solutions, giving you the chance to expand your expertise and stay ahead in the industry. If you're passionate about technology and eager to work on innovative projects that drive real business impact, this is the perfect place for you!
 


* Collaborative and supportive team culture:



 This team is dedicated to delivering high-quality solutions and services to internal or external customers. The team members work closely together, sharing knowledge and expertise to ensure that each. The project is a success. By joining this team, you will be part of a collaborative and supportive culture that values teamwork and professional development.
 



  




* Opportunity for growth and advancement:



 As a member of this team, you will have the opportunity to grow and advance your career.
 



 The team offers training and development programs to help you enhance your skills and expand your knowledge. Additionally, as the team continues to grow, there may be opportunities for leadership
 



 And management roles.
 



  





**What will this role achieve?** 




 As an SAP EDI developer, you will play a critical role in enhancing our order-to-cash, E-commerce, and logistics processes.
 



  





  





**What will be the job scope & key deliverables?** 




  




* **Enhancing EDI Integration – Improve data accuracy and automation through seamless Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) with vendors and third-party logistics providers.**
* **Prefer to have a developer background who has experience in interfacing between SAP and Legacy systems**
* **Supporting E-Commerce Systems – Integrate and optimize SAP SD/LE with our e-commerce platforms to ensure smooth order fulfillment, inventory synchronization, and real-time transaction processing.**
* **Experiencing in working with Pascal on OpenVMS preferable.**
* **Enabling Business Growth – Optimize SAP solutions to improve scalability, flexibility, and operational effectiveness, directly impacting revenue and customer satisfaction.**
* **Improving User Experience – Work closely with business teams to design user-friendly SAP functionalities, ensuring smooth adoption and efficiency across departments.**
* **Language skills: Swedish and English (mandatory** 
 )



  





  





  





**What do we need for this role?** 




  




* Experience with system development using different programming languages
* EDI knowledge – Hands-on experience with Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) integration, mapping, and troubleshooting transactions with customers and suppliers.
* Interface development experience – XML, C, C++, SQL
* E-Commerce Integration Experience – Understanding of SAP’s role in B2B/B2C e-commerce platforms, order fulfillment, and inventory synchronization.
* Experience with SAP SD/LE (Optional)
* SAP S/4HANA Knowledge (Preferred) – Experience in SAP S/4HANA migration or implementation is a plus.
* Process Improvement Mindset – Ability to analyze business needs, identify process gaps, and implement SAP solutions that enhance efficiency.
* Technical Skills – Familiarity with IDOCs, ABAP debugging, and middleware integrations is beneficial.
* Collaboration & Communication – Ability to work closely with cross-functional teams, business users, and external partners to drive successful SAP implementations and improvements.
* Problem-Solving Ability – A proactive approach to troubleshooting and resolving issues in a fast-paced environment.
* Fluent Swedish-speaking required for communicating with customers



  





 Samsung is a dynamic company in a fast-moving industry with many opportunities to grow and develop! To enjoy working with us, you must appreciate tempo, change, and taking initiative
 



  





**Sounds interesting?** 




 If you are up for the challenge and reckon that this position fits your profile, we would like to hear from you. Apply today, as we are reviewing applications ongoingly and the position might be filled before the application deadline.

title: Product Manager
description:
**Who we are 🏃 ♂️** 




 Welcome to Findity, the tech provider fueling Europe’s leading edge in expense management solutions! We empower over 30,000 corporate entities and more than 290,000 employees to conquer their financial challenges with ease. Join us in revolutionizing how businesses thrive in the digital age!
 



  





**What we do🚀** 




 At Findity, we constantly strive to eliminate expense management for every individual and business so they can focus on what matters. Expense management is for many a must and not a want, that is why we partner with the leading software and financial institutes to eliminate the pain of dealing with expenses.
 



  





**The role 🙋** 




 As a Product Manager you will own, build, operate and scale our API-first expense management experience for partners and developers. You will be responsible for the full customer journey for our API-product. This also includes technical writing for our Developer Portal so partners and developers can integrate smoothly and effortlessly to the Findity platform.
 



  





 As the Product Manager API, you will be a member of the Product-team with other product managers and UX, as well as a part of a cross-functional "squad" with developers, tech lead/scrum master and QA. You will be working with talented development teams and execute on our product vision and roadmap by creating and delivering innovative solutions that solve real-world customer problems.
 



  





**What you will do 🫶** 




 You will be responsible for managing our suite of APIs, ensuring they deliver the best possible experience for our clients. As our API-product is new and one of our most prioritized innovation projects, you will need to be hands-on, technically proficient and comfortable collaborating with engineers and product teams to ensure the customer journey is amazing and documentation is accurate and easy to understand.
 



  





**Responsibilities 👩 💻** 




  




* Work closely with Product Leadership to create and maintain a product backlog aligned with the roadmap, business goals, and overall strategy.
* Manage epic and feature backlog prioritisation, and work with the tech lead / scrum master in your Squad (Development Team) to run sprint planning, backlog refinement, sprint reviews and other Scrum ceremonies.
* Create a vision for new features and break down into user stories and ensure they are ready for development and contain clear acceptance criteria.
* Work and collaborate with your Squad (Development Team) and other stakeholders to ensure the committed user stories are completed, tested and released with high quality.
* Monitor the quality of your domain together with your Squad (Development team) and act quickly on business-critical bugs and errors.
* Support New business, Existing business, Product Support and other teams with knowledge of new features and product changes.
