title: BI-analytiker
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **3+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

 **Rollbeskrivning**:


Vi söker nu en BI-analytiker.  

Uppdragsbeskrivning:
  

  

Kund söker en driven BI analytiker till Digitaliseringsenheten. Digitaliseringsenheten ingår i avdelningen för verksamhetsstöd som har till uppgift att säkerställa en stödjande verksamhet i balans med kärnverksamhetens behov.  

  

Digitaliseringsenheten har i uppdrag att utveckla verksamhetsnära digitala lösningar för att möta de utvecklingsbehov som finns inom kundens olika verksamhetsdelar. Enheten har ett helhetsansvar för nyutveckling, underhåll och support. Digitaliseringsenheten består av fyra agila utvecklingsteam som har hög ambition och arbetar med moderna metoder och verktyg och präglas av innovation och nytänkande.  

  

Placering: Kundens kontor i Stockholm men med viss möjlighet till distansarbete.  

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**  

  

Som BI-analytiker i vårt datafångstteam är du central i att driva vår transformation mot en mer **insiktsdriven myndighet**. Du ansvarar för att omvandla verksamhetens behov till tydliga och användarvänliga rapporter i Power BI on-premise där du skapar struktur i data och lyfter fram de insikter som gör skillnad. Arbetet innefattar att samla in krav, modellera data och bygga rapporter och dashboards som inte bara visar siffror utan berättar en historia. Du kommer att samarbeta nära både tekniska specialister och verksamhetsnära användare och bidra till att våra data blir ett effektivt beslutsstöd. I rollen ingår även att säkerställa datakvalitet, förbättra befintliga lösningar och vara en drivande kraft i att utveckla vårt sätt att arbeta med datadriven analys.  

  

  



**Krav**
--------

**Skallkrav**:


* Relevant akademisk utbildning inom data/IT (t.ex. systemvetenskap, datavetenskap, statistik eller liknande) eller motsvarande erfarenhet som bedöms likvärdig.
* Minst 2–3 års aktuell och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet för rollen
* Mycket goda kunskaper i att bygga rapporter och visualiseringar i Power BI (gärna on-premise).
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med SSAS-kuber (SQL Server Analysis Services) och ha en förståelse för hur data modelleras och struktureras för effektiv analys i Power BI.
* Förmåga att kommunicera insikter på ett pedagogiskt och visuellt tilltalande sätt (“data storytelling”).
* Goda kunskaper i SQL och erfarenhet av att arbeta med relationsdatabaser.
* Erfarenhet av kravinsamling och nära dialog med verksamheten för att förstå behov och omsätta dem i BI-lösningar.
* Strukturerat arbetssätt med fokus på datakvalitet, användbarhet och leveranssäkerhet.
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska
* Utvärdering av de personliga egenskaperna kommer att ske vid en eventuell intervju

**Börkrav**:


* Förståelse för grundläggande design- och UX-principer för att skapa tydliga och användarvänliga rapporter.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med färgsättning, layout och visualisering för att förstärka budskap i data.
* Förmåga att coacha och utbilda andra i BI-verktyg och datadrivet arbetssätt.
* Erfarenhet av att samarbeta med andra i agila utvecklingsprojekt

**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: UX Designer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

* Conduct user research and usability testing, iterating designs based on feedback.
* Translate business requirements and user needs into wireframes and interactive prototypes using Figma and our design system.
* Actively participate in agile ceremonies, design reviews, and continuously improve ways of working.

 **Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

Proven UX Design Experience (3 years of experience needed)  

* Demonstrated track record of designing user-centered digital products, with a strong portfolio showcasing end-to-end UX processes.

Proficiency in Figma & Design Systems  

* Ability to create wireframes, prototypes, and hi-fi designs within established design systems.

  

User Research & Usability Testing Skills  

* Hands-on experience planning, conducting, and synthesizing user research and usability tests to inform design iterations.

  

Experience in Agile, Cross-Functional Teams  

* Comfortable collaborating closely with developers, product owners, and stakeholders in agile ceremonies (e.g., sprint planning, retros).

  

Excellent communication in Swedish and English  

* Can clearly communicate ideas and collaborate across languages and teams.

**Meritorious**  

* Experience with design systems (understanding how to apply and evolve a shared design system).

  

* Strong problem-solving and iteration mindset.

  

**Application deadline:** 27-10-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Data Engineer
description:
Bygg framtidens datalösningar med oss!


Är du en passionerad Data Engineer som vill att varje dag ska vara både rolig och utvecklande? Vill du jobba med ett sammansvetsat gäng av experter där din kod och dina idéer verkligen gör skillnad? Då kan du vara den vi letar efter!


Rebel and Bird är en techbyrå i hjärtat av Stockholm. Vi är ett team på cirka 40 utvecklare, arkitekter, strateger, designers och UX-experter som tillsammans hjälper våra kunder att skapa digitala produkter och tjänster i världsklass.


Vår kultur bygger på ett genuint intresse för teknik, design och affärsutveckling, och vi tror att det bästa jobbet görs när man har roligt tillsammans.


Just nu växer vårt datateam, och vi söker två seniora Data Engineers som vill vara med och forma ryggraden i våra kunders datadrivna transformation.


Vad du kommer att göra hos oss


Som Data Engineer hos Rebel and Bird kommer du att arbeta i spännande projekt där du får ta ett stort ansvar från start till mål. Du kommer att vara en nyckelperson som omvandlar komplexa affärsbehov till robusta, skalbara och insiktsdrivna datalösningar.


Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter blir att:

* Designa och bygga effektiva datalager och pipelines med moderna verktyg som Databricks, Pyspark och Spark SQL.
* Översätta affärskrav till lösningar som skapar konkret värde för våra kunder.
* Sätta upp och underhålla automatiserade CI/CD-flöden i Azure DevOps för att säkerställa kvalitet och effektivitet.
* Strukturera och modellera data enligt beprövade principer (som Kimball) för att maximera prestanda och användbarhet.
* Agera som teknisk expert och rådgivare, både för dina kollegor och i dialogen med våra kunder.


Vem är du?


Vi söker dig som är en självgående och trygg konsult med en passion för både data och verksamhetsnytta. Du är inte rädd för att ta egna initiativ och trivs i en miljö där du får stort förtroende. Du är en lagspelare som uppskattar att dela med dig av din kunskap lika mycket som du gillar att lära dig nytt.


Vi tror att du har gedigen erfarenhet av:

* Databricks, Pyspark och Spark SQL.
* CI/CD i Azure DevOps, inklusive YAML-pipelines och artifakthantering.
* Datamodellering och förstår vikten av en välstrukturerad grund.
* Att arbeta konsultativt och kommunicera tekniska lösningar på ett pedagogiskt sätt.


Varför Rebel and Bird?


Vi vet att duktiga konsulter kan välja och vraka. Här är varför vi tror att du kommer att trivas hos oss:

* Spännande projekt & meningsfullhet: Vi jobbar med kunder som litar på oss och ger oss friheten att skapa riktigt bra lösningar som används av tusentals människor.
* Kompetenta och härliga kollegor: Du blir en del av ett team där alla brinner för sitt hantverk. Vi stöttar varandra, lär av varandra och har väldigt kul på vägen. Vi har ett snitt på över 15 års arbetserfarenhet.
* Utveckling och frihet: Hos oss får du stort ansvar och möjlighet att påverka både dina projekt och vår gemensamma utveckling. "Högt i tak" är inte bara en klyscha här.
* En schysst deal: Vi erbjuder en konkurrenskraftig lön, bra förmåner och en arbetsplats där balansen mellan jobb och fritid är viktig för alla.
* Stockholms skönaste kontor: Vårt kontor ligger mitt i stan – perfekt för luncher, after works och en smidig pendling.


Praktisk information

* Plats: Vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm.
* Omfattning: Heltid, 100%.
* Start: Omgående eller enligt överenskommelse.


Känner du igen dig? Då vill vi mer än gärna höra från dig! Skicka in din ansökan redan idag så pratar vi mer. Vi ser fram emot att träffa vår nästa rebell!

title: Digital kommunikationsspecialist och produktionsledare (vikariat)
description:
*Att bygga och sköta om vägar och infrastruktur är stort. Att bidra till samhällsutvecklingen är ännu större. Hos oss får du göra både och. Nu söker vi en vikarie till rollen som digital kommunikationsspecialist och produktionsledare till* huvudkontoret i Stockholm. ***Vikariatet gäller*** **den 1 december 2025 - 17 juli 2026***.*  

*Inom Svevia kombinerar vi det lilla företagets gemenskap och lagkänsla med storföretagets stabilitet.* Här får du möjlighet att utvecklas och utveckla andra som en specialist på väg - med engagemang, samarbete och ansvar.


###### **Ditt uppdrag som digital kommunikationsspecialist & produktionsledare**

Rollen är bred och du kommer att arbetar både strategiskt och operativt med digital kommunikation, webb och systemförvaltning. Som produktionsledare har du en nyckelroll i att samordna teknik, innehåll och kommunikationsinsatser både internt och externt.


I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår allt från innehållsproduktion och nyhetsbrev till analys, verktygshantering och samarbete med externa byråer och leverantörer. Rollen kräver ett strukturerat arbetssätt och god samarbetsförmåga men också teknisk förståelse och kreativ förmåga.


Exempel på arbetsområden:


* Webb och intranät.
* Ansvara för innehåll och samordning med IT och externa leverantörer.
* Digital analys och mätning - Följa upp och analysera data via Google Analytics, GTM och Looker Studio. Säkerställa KPI-uppföljning.
* SEO/SEM och annonsering - Samordna digitala kampanjer och annonsering i samarbete med byrå.
* Nyhetsbrev och utskick - Skapa och hantera utskick via Apsis och Lime Newsletter.
* Innehållsproduktion - Producera enklare grafiskt material och bidra med ett UX-perspektiv.
* Internkommunikation och produktionsstöd - Ta fram innehåll för intranät och digitala skärmar samt stötta teamet med produktionsledning.

###### **Vem är du?**

För oss är det viktigt att du inte bara trivs med arbetsuppgifterna, utan också med människorna. Vi gillar att hänga med varandra, och vi hoppas att du vill hänga med oss.
  

  

Vi tror att du är både strukturerad och analytisk, samtidigt som du har en kreativ ådra som hjälper dig att tänka nytt. Du är nyfiken på teknik och digitala verktyg.


Du har en god förståelse för tonalitet, varumärkesidentitet och användarupplevelse, och vet hur du anpassar budskap för att nå rätt målgrupp på rätt sätt. Du drivs av att skapa resultat och har ett tydligt fokus på effekt i allt du gör.


###### **En del av något större**

Inom Svevia kombinerar vi det lilla företagets gemenskap och lagkänsla med storföretagets stabilitet. Vi är ett prestigelöst team med ambitionen att tillsammans skapa den bästa och mest effektiva kommunikationen. Du blir en del av ett engagerat team med uppdraget att skapa förtroende, stolthet och tydlighet – både inom företaget och i samhället


Hos oss på Svevia är kommunikationen en del av vägen framåt. Som en del av kommunikationsavdelningen arbetar du med att stärka Svevias varumärke, utveckla vår interna och externa kommunikation och bidra till en tydlig, enhetlig berättelse om vilka vi är och vart vi är på väg.


Vi strävar efter att hela tiden utveckla oss för att på nya och gamla sätt berätta om allt bra Svevia gör, om hur vi knyter ihop land och stad, om hur hållbarhet har blivit en självklar del av affären och om vår ambition om att vara den bästa arbetsplatsen, en inkluderande arbetsplats. Vi vilar i våra värderingar; engagemang, samarbete och ansvar.

###### **Varför Svevia?**

Hos oss blir du snabbt en i gänget och vi månar om att vara en arbetsplats för alla. Beslutsvägarna är korta, det är lätt att påverka och göra sin röst hörd.


Vi har karriärvägarna för dig som både vill bli chef och ledare eller vill utvecklas i din befintliga yrkesroll. Framgången skapar vi som ett lag. Det är så vi gör affärer och genererar resultat. Det är så vi får stad och land att fungera. Vill du dela väg med oss?

###### **Ansökan och information**

*Du ansöker enkelt genom att skicka in ditt CV och svara på några urvalsfrågor. Vår rekryteringsprocess bygger på ett kompetensbaserat arbetssätt, det är en förutsättning för att rekrytera kvalitetssäkert, inkluderande och fördomsfritt. Därför vill vi inte ha ett personligt brev.*

*Skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt och som senast den 5e november**. Urval görs löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.*

*Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta varumärkeschef Emma Wistrand, emma.wikstrand@svevia.se. Har du frågor om rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att höra av dig till Talent Acquisition Partner Ludvig Zetterman Dahlen, ludvig.zetterman-dahlen@svevia.se.*

 *Vi har tagit ställning till annonsering, vilket gör att vi inte önskar säljsamtal för ytterligare frågor kring annonsering, rekrytering eller bemanning.*

title: Operations Graduate Program 2026 - Data Analyst Assembly
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**Volvo Group Operations Graduate Program**
-------------------------------------------

If you are up for the challenge of developing our future Operations and want to be a part of the innovative world of Volvo Group, this is the graduate program for you!

  

  

During 15 intense and exciting months, our Operations Graduate Program will give you a holistic view of our operational and logistic activities, including both the local and global perspective. You will be working with the technologies of tomorrow, building the products of the future – electric, connected and automated. In parallel, you will grow as a person, through individual and team development sessions.

  

You will have a permanent position from day one, with a manager and mentor to support you. You will experience several local and international on the job-rotations and work on business-critical projects developing your competencies for tomorrow. You will take a deep dive into some specific areas of our business such as manufacturing, health and safety, quality, and continuous improvements, while also learning about the end-to-end supply chain, aftermarket parts and our remanufacturing operations. In addition, you will gather with other program participants to take part in trainings and events designed to help you grow into your future career at the Volvo Group.

  

We offer the opportunity for you to be part of our digital transformation, applying new technologies to connect and automate our processes. Together we work with AI, data science, machine learning, circular systems, virtual manufacturing and more, to build our full electric or autonomous products.

  

If rotational development, a global set up and designing the world of tomorrow are aspects you are looking for in your next job context, this position might be something for you.

**Our Organization**
--------------------


Volvo Group Trucks Operations (GTO) in Skövde is a vital part of the Volvo Group’s global manufacturing network. Located in Skövde, Sweden, the facility specializes in engine manufacturing as well as the production of wheel hub, batteries, and e-axles. Through its advanced operations, the site plays a significant role in supporting the Volvo Group’s commitment to technological innovation and sustainable transport solutions.

**This is us, your new team**
-----------------------------


The Manufacturing Engineering Assembly team consists of 18 engineers specializing in engines, batteries, and e-axles. Our responsibilities include design, optimization, EOL verification and management of product assembly processes within a manufacturing environment.

**Main activities and responsibilities**
----------------------------------------


As a Data Analyst Assembly, you will support our engineering and production teams by finding ways to use Smart Business Data in production processes. Your role will include troubleshooting and identifying operational challenges, as well as detecting bottlenecks and proposing data-driven countermeasures. You will analyze production flows and logistics to reduce losses and improve efficiency. Additionally, you will develop transparent and intuitive visualizations that clearly present production data and insights.

**Who are you?**
----------------


We are seeking a person who demonstrates strong creativity, collaborative thinking and analytical skills. You possess a genuine interest in and understanding of our products and systems with the ability to ensure user-friendly solutions. The ideal candidate is highly self-motivated, takes initiative, and works independently to drive projects forward.

**Required knowledge/experience:**
----------------------------------

* You may hold a degree in one of the following, or a similar discipline: Bachelor or Master's in Circular Economy, Data Science, Sustainability, Business Administration, Industrial Economics and Management, Automation Engineering, UX design, Data Science with a focus on production or industrial management
* Experience within manufacturing or operational business and familiarity with production excellence methodologies such as TPM, Lean, Six Sigma, or PDCA is considered an advantage, but not a requirement.
* Maximum two years of previous full-time working experience, prior to or after graduation. Work during studies are not included.
* In this truly global program, communication will be in English, hence you need to be fluent in both speaking and writing in Swedish and English.
* Valid work or study permit for Sweden if not a citizen.
**Curious, and have some questions? Contact us!**
-------------------------------------------------

Manager: Jesper Lundberg, +46 72 8623400, jesper.lundberg@volvo.com  

HRBP: Olle Bergman, +46 76 5535392, +46 790624220, olle.bergman@volvo.com

  

Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

 **Group Trucks Operations** encompasses all production of the Group’s manufacturing of Volvo, Renault and Mack trucks, as well as engines and transmissions. We also orchestrate the spare parts distribution for Volvo Group’s customers globally and design, operate and optimize logistics and supply chains for all brands. We count 30,000 employees at 30 plants and 50 distribution centers across the globe. Our global footprint offers an opportunity for an international career in a state-of-the-art industrial environment, where continuous improvement is the foundation. As our planet is facing great challenges, we - one of the largest industrial organizations in the world - stand at the forefront of innovation. We are ready to rise to the challenge. Would you like to join us?
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Teknisk kravanalytiker till nya polisbilarna
description:
**Organisation**It-avdelningen


**Kommun**Stockholm


**Län**Stockholms län


**Utlyst**07 oktober 2025


**Ansök senast**27 oktober 2025


**Referensnummer**PB50/2025


**Arbetsplatsbeskrivning**
--------------------------


Är du redo för en större uppgift? Nu söker vi en tekniskt kunnig kravanalytiker. Har du arkitektur-kompetens, en vana av att driva projekt samt är kommunikativt lagd? Då kan du vara den vi söker!
  

  

Polismyndigheten är Sveriges största myndighet med ca 40 000 medarbetare över hela landet. Hos oss får du möjlighet att bidra till Polisens uppdrag – att öka tryggheten och minska brottsligheten i samhället.
  

  

IT-avdelningens främsta uppgift är att tillhandahålla IT-tjänster till hela Polismyndigheten. IT-avdelningen en viktig del av det brottsförebyggande och brottsbekämpande arbetet och IT är ett av de viktigaste verktygen för att effektivisera polisen och öka kvaliteten i polisarbetet. IT-avdelningen utvecklar och moderniserar polisens IT och myndigheten satsar mycket på att stärka avdelningen med ny specialistkompetens och den senaste teknologin till nytta för medborgarna och medarbetarna i den polisiära verksamheten.
  

  

Gruppen Fordonssystem ingår i sektionen Operativa Verksamhetssystem. Gruppens uppdrag är att säkerställa att poliserna i yttre tjänst har bästa möjliga IT-stöd i den nya generationens polisbilar. Vi har en modern och världsunik IT-plattform i de nya bilarna som blir ett kraftfullt redskap för att förbättra skyddet av egen personal och utrustning samt förbättra polisens förmåga att förebygga, utreda och lagföra brott.
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
---------------------


I vår grupp arbetar systemutvecklare, testare, uppdragsledare, en UX-designer och tekniska produktspecialister. Vårt arbete styrs delvis av lagar och förordningar men inte minst den polisiära verksamhetens behov, därav ingår verksamhetsbesök och workshops i arbetet.
  

  

Som teknisk kravanalytiker hos oss arbetar du i en agil miljö där arbetsklimatet genomsyras av högt engagemang och driv. Du kommer att medverka i såväl nyutveckling som förvaltning där du översätter verksamhetsbehov till tillämpbara systemlösningar och utvecklingsbara krav i nära arbete med systemarkitekter. Det innebär att du kommer arbeta med varierande uppgifter så som analys, kartläggning och dokumentation av verksamhetens behov som behövs för att lyckas med våra leveranser. Du kommer även leda och samordna framtagning av krav, både funktionella och icke-funktionella.
**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


Detta är en möjlighet för dig som har:  

* Examen inom IT, alternativt annan relevant utbildning eller erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig
* Aktuell och för tjänsten relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT
* Flerårig aktuell och relevant erfarenhet som kravanalytiker med framtagande av funktionella och icke funktionella krav.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska i såväl tal som skrift
  

Det är meriterande om du även har:  
* Erfarenhet av krav av hårdvarunära systemutveckling
* Relevant erfarenhet av att ha arbetat som produktägare och/ eller projektledning
* Arbetat som systemutvecklare, lösningsarkitekt eller liknande teknisk roll.
* Erfarenhet av Jira/Confluence

  

Personliga egenskaper
  

Vi söker dig som har en analytisk förmåga, är ansvarstagande och ha ett starkt driv tillsammans med ett kreativt tänkande. Du vill hela tiden arbeta för att vi tillsammans kontinuerligt levererar så bra lösningar som möjligt. Du är en anpassningsbar lagspelare som har lätt för att samarbeta, du är även kommunikativ och kan hantera många kontaktytor. Vår kravanalytiker driver workshops och expertgrupper med verksamheten för att ta fram utvecklingsbara krav din kommunikationsförmåga är central.  

  

Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
**Kontaktpersoner**
-------------------


Rekryterande chef  

010-56 378 05  

  

Anna Josefsson Ahlvin, HR-konsult  

anna.josefsson-ahlvin@polisen.se
**Fackliga företrädare**
------------------------


Sofia Ask, Polisförbundet  

010-563 87 10  

  

Saco-S  

saco-s.avdelningarna@polisen.se  

  

Karna Tillheden, SEKO Polisen  

010-561 66 27  

  

Jessica Stålenkrans , ST  

010-563 32 66
**Övrig information**
---------------------


Anställningsbenämning: Handläggare  

Arbetsort: Stockholm, Kungsholmen  

Arbetstid: Flexibel arbetstid  

Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse  

Funktion: Kravanalytiker
  

  

Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.  

  

Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.
  

  

Vi använder e-rekrytering för att effektivisera och kvalitetssäkra rekryteringsarbetet. Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Polisens rekryteringsstöd Visma Recruit.
  

  

Har du skyddade personuppgifter, referenser eller liknande information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd rekommenderar vi att du kontaktar ansvarig HR-konsult innan du går vidare med din ansökan.  

  

Om du vill komplettera din ansökan vänder du dig till ansvarig HR-konsult.  

  

En anställning hos Polismyndigheten kan komma att inledas med en provanställning om sex månader.  

  

Polismyndigheten är Sveriges största myndighet. Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som stimulerar till mångfald, kreativitet och personlig utveckling.  

Läs gärna om våra förmåner som anställd hos polisen på: polisen.se/erbjudande  

Vi bedriver vår verksamhet enligt vår värdegrund: engagemang, effektivitet och tillgänglighet. Som medarbetare inom polisen agerar du för likabehandling. Det är en förutsättning för rättssäkerhet, rättstrygghet och för polisens legitimitet i samhället. Som företrädare för polisen respekterar du allas lika värde och skapar förtroende för polisen.  

  

Läs gärna mer om polisen och vår verksamhet på polisen.se  

  

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!  

  

Vi undanber oss samtal och mail från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.
**Sök jobbet**
--------------


Ansökan sker via polisens rekryteringsverktyg

title: UX Designer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Job Description**
* Conduct user research and usability testing, iterating designs based on feedback.
* Translate business requirements and user needs into wireframes and interactive prototypes using Figma and our design system.
* Actively participate in agile ceremonies, design reviews, and continuously improve ways of working.


**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
 Proven UX Design Experience (3 years of experience needed)
   

  

* Demonstrated track record of designing user-centered digital products, with a strong portfolio showcasing end-to-end UX processes.


 Proficiency in Figma & Design Systems
   

  

* Ability to create wireframes, prototypes, and hi-fi designs within established design systems.


 User Research & Usability Testing Skills
   

  

* Hands-on experience planning, conducting, and synthesizing user research and usability tests to inform design iterations.


 Experience in Agile, Cross-Functional Teams
   

  

* Comfortable collaborating closely with developers, product owners, and stakeholders in agile ceremonies (e.g., sprint planning, retros).


 Excellent communication in Swedish and English
   

  

* Can clearly communicate ideas and collaborate across languages and teams.


**Meritorious**
* Experience with design systems (understanding how to apply and evolve a shared design system).
* Strong problem-solving and iteration mindset.


**Application deadline:** 
 27-10-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: UX/UI Designer internship – Early-Stage Startup (NordComply)
description:
About NordComply
 



  





 NordComply is a new AI-powered compliance automation platform helping Swedish SMEs simplify GDPR, ESG, and HR compliance. We’re in our early growth phase — building our MVP, testing features with users, and shaping the future of compliance tech in Sweden.
 



  





 We’re now looking for a hands-on UX Designer who loves the challenge of designing from zero and isn’t afraid to build, test, and iterate quickly.
 



  





 ⸻
 



  





 What You’ll Do
 



 • Help define and design the NordComply product experience from concept to prototype
 



  





 • Create wireframes, mockups, and prototypes in Figma
 



  





 • Collaborate closely with the founder, developers, and AI engineers
 



  





 • Bring fresh, creative ideas that make compliance tools simple and human
 



  









 • Work closely with the founder and developers to improve user experience
 



  





 ⸻
 



  





 You’re a Great Fit If You:
 



 • Are excited by the idea of joining an early-stage startup
 



 • Have solid experience in Figma and UX/UI principles
 



 • Enjoy taking ownership and making independent design decisions
 



 • Are resourceful, self-motivated, and eager to grow
 



 • Can handle both user research and interface design
 



  





 • (Bonus) Have interest in AI, SaaS, or automation tools
 



  





  





 Why Join Us
 



 • Real experience shaping a product from the ground up
 



 • Close collaboration with the founder and core team
 



 • Opportunity for professional growth
 







  





  





 How to Apply
 



  





 Apply directly on LinkedIn or send your CV and a short introduction to
 



 Joanna.adermark@tutanota.com

title: User Experience Designer
description: Hands-on experience with Adobe Premiere, Final Cut, After Effects (Adobe), Audacity, Audition (Adobe) or similar. - Strong understanding of design principles, lighting, and composition. - Experience with graphic design and video editing. - Strong understanding of instructional design principles and adult learning theories. - Excellent organizational skills. - Ability to work collaboratively with SPMs, SMEs, and other stakeholders. - Strong written and verbal communication skills

title: UX UI Designer
description:
Role Description:
 



 Motion design and Visual design Design and produce multimedia content and visual assets (e.g., videos, animations, illustrations, icons) following client design guidelines.
 



  





 Create and adapt UXUI components and layouts that ensure consistency, accessibility, and alignment with project objectives.
 



 Design different models based on client guidelines and use cases, coherent and consistent with client visual language
 



 Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (design, development, communications, and learning) to ensure cohesive design delivery and content alignment.
 



 Contribute to UUI design tasks such as wireframing, prototyping, user flow definition, and usability improvements.
 



 Support design documentation and handoff to developers or other stakeholders
 



  





 Required Skills
 



 Bachelors degree in Design, Multimedia, Human Computer Interaction, or a related field.
 



 Hands-on experience on Adobe Premiere, Final Cut, After Effects (Adobe), Audacity, Audition (Adobe) or similar and knowledge on design principles, lighting and composition.
 



 Experience with graphic design and video editing.
 



 Strong understanding of instructional design principles and adult learning theories.
 



  





 Excellent organizational skills.
 



 Ability to work collaboratively with SPMs, SMEs, and other stakeholders.
 



 Strong written and verbal communication skills.
 



 Attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality work.
 



 Strong sense of visual storytelling
 



  





 Competencies: Digital : User Experience Design (UXD)/ Visual Design

title: Product Designer - Kids shoes
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for an experienced Kids Shoe Designer with a strong creative eye, attention to finer detail and fashion sensibility to join us at H&M's head office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 You will be part of a fast-paced environment and work with youthful, elevated fashion products that welcome everyone! This role is designing across both Boys and Girls from Newborn, Baby, Child and Teenager.
   

  

 As a Product Specialist, you'll drive and identify key products, translating them into commercial collections. You should have strong design process skills and be able to communicate your vision clearly with a creative, fashion-forward focus.
   

  

**Who You’ll Work With**
 You'll collaborate with a team to provide diverse markets with the best products sold worldwide through H&M's omni channels. Your handwriting will demonstrate a strong fashion trend awareness and genuine passion for shoes! Maintaining a high fashion sense for style and trends for the target customer, while being cost-conscious throughout the design process, is essential. The role demands high energy, creativity, and experience in coaching and leading others to commercial success!
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with:*
* BA/MA or equivalent experience in Fashion Footwear/Product Design
* Minimum of 4 years’ work experience as a Designer with a strength in overall collection building
* High knowledge of materials, technical details, and processes of footwear
* A visionary mindset with true passion for women’s fashion, current and future trends
* A strong customer focus and commercial mindset for the H&M customer
* Experience working with suppliers/factories in Asia and Europe
* Skilled in working in Adobe Creative Suite programs
* 3D is meriting
* Demonstrated communication skills and true collaborative team player
* Leadership and coaching mindset
* Independent and proactive approach
* Able to set priorities with an organized & structured approach
* Flexible mindset and adaptable to changes in a fast moving & growing industry
* Fluent in English (Swedish not necessary)


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here
 *In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are. Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 If this sounds interesting and you fit the qualifications,
 **apply asap with CV and design portfolio** 
 (pdf max 10mb/uploading). Assessments will start immediately.
   

  

 All documents should be in English. This is a full time permanent position starting as soon as possible at our H&M Head office in Stockholm, Sweden working on site.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Adobe Photoshop & Visual Design Internship
description:
🚀
 **Join Arfve Accelerator 2025 – Adobe Photoshop & Visual Design Internship** 




  





  





 Are you passionate about bringing ideas to life through powerful visuals?
 



  





 Do you love working with Photoshop, crafting stunning images, product visuals, and campaign assets that capture attention and emotion?
 



  





**Arfve Accelerator 2025** 
 is looking for a
 **Photoshop & Visual Design Intern** 
 to help shape the next chapter of our modular, intelligent, and sustainable tech products through creative design, image editing, and storytelling.
 



  





 🌟
 **About the Program** 




  





 Arfve is redefining how technology is designed, used, and experienced. We’re searching for creative minds who can turn product imagery into captivating visual stories for campaigns, product launches, and brand communications.
 



  





 📋
 **Program Overview** 




  





 ⏳ Duration: 12–20 weeks (preferred immediate start)
 



 💼 Type: Initially unpaid internship with potential to transition into a paid role
 



 🌍 Remote with flexible working hours
 



 🎯 Who: Design students, recent graduates, or early-career creators passionate about Photoshop, branding, and storytelling
 



  





 🎨
 **Role – Adobe Photoshop & Visual Design Intern** 




  





 You’ll be responsible for creating and enhancing visual assets that represent Arfve’s identity and products, including:
 


* Editing and enhancing product photos and renders for campaign use
* Designing promotional images, social media posts, and visual layouts
* Creating color/material variations and compositions using brand guidelines
* Retouching and refining images to achieve premium, photorealistic quality
* Assisting in concept visualization for upcoming campaigns and launches



  





 🛠️
 **Required & Advantageous Skills/Tools** 




  





**Required:** 



* Adobe Photoshop (strong proficiency required)
* Good understanding of composition, color balance, and visual hierarchy



**Advantageous:** 



* Adobe Illustrator, Lightroom, or Figma
* Basic knowledge of motion graphics or 3D visualization
* Interest in branding, minimal design, and Scandinavian-inspired aesthetics



  





 ✅
 **Why Join Us?** 



* Work directly on real brand assets and visuals for a global product launch
* Build a portfolio that showcases premium, design-driven work
* Collaborate with creative and engineering teams across multiple functions
* Learn industry-standard workflows and contribute to a fast-evolving brand



  





 💡
 **What We Value** 



* Creativity and attention to detail
* A strong visual sense and curiosity for design trends
* Eagerness to learn and adapt quickly
* Accountability, openness, and initiative



  





 📧
 **How to Apply** 




  





 Apply directly through
 **LinkedIn Easy Apply** 
 , and send an email to
 **suvyaktha@arfve.com** 
 with:
 



  




* A short note on what excites you about this internship
* Your resume
* A portfolio or sample of your visual work (if available)



  





 🕒
 **Start:** 
 Immediate preferred
 



 🌍
 **Format:** 
 Fully remote with flexible hours and weekly check-ins
 



 🎯 Let’s design visuals that inspire, craft stories that connect, and build the future of tech with
 **Arfve** 
 .
 



 💡 More info: arfve.com
 



 👉
 **Apply today and join Arfve Accelerator 2025!**

title: Social Media Intern (TikTok, Reels, Shorts) — HealthTech Startup Revolutionizing Sleep
description:
In line with what leading scientists say today: “
 ***The most powerful biohack is getting a good night’s sleep***
 ,” we’re committed to developing the most effective natural sleep enhancement technology in the world.
 



  





**Introduction** 




  





 Are you passionate about creating innovative
 **short-form video experiences** 
 that can impact global health? Join us in revolutionizing sleep health with cutting-edge storytelling as a
 **Social Media Intern (TikTok, Reels, Shorts)** 
 . We’re looking for a motivated, curious intern to work closely with our founding team on building what will become the most effective medically certified solution for improved sleep.
 



  





**About Us** 




  





 We are a dynamic health tech startup, focused on addressing the widespread issue of poor sleep quality that affects billions worldwide. Our mission is to develop groundbreaking solutions that enhance sleep by leveraging the latest advancements in technology and science. If you’re passionate about improving sleep health and want hands-on experience in an early-stage startup, we want you on this journey.
 



  





**The Role (What you’ll do)** 




  




* **Own short-form content** 
 : ideate, script, shoot, and edit vertical videos for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.
* **Turn science into stories** 
 : translate complex sleep insights into punchy, human, 6–45s narratives with strong hooks and satisfying loops.
* **Prototype fast** 
 : produce multiple variants (A/B hooks, captions, thumbnails, sounds) and iterate based on data.
* **Analyze performance** 
 : track retention, watch time, “viewers stayed,” CTR, and follower growth; present weekly insights and next steps.
* **Community & creation** 
 : engage in comments/DMs, source UGC, and coordinate with creators/influencers.
* **Brand & compliance** 
 : protect our voice, visual system, and claims guidelines for health content on each platform.
* **Content ops** 
 : maintain a light content calendar, asset library, and posting workflows that scale.



  





**About You** 




  




* A portfolio or links to
 **vertical videos** 
 you’ve made (TikTok/Reels/Shorts).
* Obsessed with
 **hooks, pacing, and retention** 
 ; you think in first frames and loop points.
* Solid editing skills in
 **CapCut (mobile/desktop), Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or DaVinci** 
 ; comfortable with captions, timing, and light color/audio polish.
* Strong, concise
 **copywriting** 
 for on-screen text and captions; smart with hashtags/SEO.
* Data-curious: you love testing ideas and letting results guide the next cut.
* Excellent communication, collaborative mindset, and a bias to action.
* Bonus: motion graphics, thumbnail design (Figma/Canva), creator outreach, paid social basics, or familiarity with health/wellness topics.



  





**What We Offer** 




  




* **A meaningful seat** 
 in a mission tackling a global health challenge.
* **Close collaboration** 
 with the founding team across product, science, and engineering.
* **Real ownership** 
 : ship work that reaches users quickly and see your impact in the data.
* **Flexibility, autonomy** 
 , and a creative, supportive environment.
* **Potential post-internship opportunities** 
 based on performance.



  





**Apply:** 




  





 Ready to make a difference in global sleep health? Please send us your application. We’re eager to embark on this impactful journey with you!
 



  





  





***The internship is unpaid but may lead to future employment incl. equity.***

title: Product Manager Campaigns at Regional Relevance - H&M Womenswear
description:
**Job Description**
 An exciting opportunity has opened up for a Product Manager to join our Regional Relevance team at H&M, focusing on creating collections and campaigns tailored for diverse global markets. This role offers the chance to make a strong impact on how we deliver fashion that resonates locally while staying true to our brand DNA.
   

  

 This position is based at our HQ in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Product Manager for Regional Relevance, you will take ownership of the product strategy and lead the development of commercially strong and culturally relevant assortments for our campaigns. You will translate regional insights, trends, and customer needs into actionable product decisions that drive growth, profitability, and brand impact.
   

  

 You will guide the team through the full product development cycle – from concept to execution – ensuring alignment across functions and securing operational excellence. Your ability to challenge, empower, and inspire others will be key in delivering collections that are both desirable and commercially successful.
   

  

 You will:
   

  

* Define and execute a clear product strategy for regional relevance, balancing creativity and commerciality.
* Translate regional insights and cultural moments into strong product offerings.
* Drive seasonal keys and campaign assortments from concept to final sample, ensuring quality, fit, and price targets.
* Collaborate closely with Design, Product Development, Pattern Making, Planning, and Production for seamless execution.
* Continuously refine assortment and component strategies based on performance and market shifts.
* Ensure products deliver great value for money by balancing fashion, quality, price, and sustainability.
* Lead confidently through change and complexity, fostering a culture of agility and ownership.


  

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a strategic and hands-on leader with a strong passion for fashion and product. You thrive in a fast-paced, global environment and have the ability to navigate multiple markets and cultural contexts. You combine creativity with commercial thinking, ensuring that every product reflects both regional relevance and brand identity.
   

  

 Qualifications:
   

  

* Extensive experience in fashion and/or retail, with a proven track record in product development or assortment strategy.
* A sharp eye for fashion and trends, with the ability to interpret them into commercially strong products.
* Strong leadership skills – able to inspire and guide cross-functional teams, even without formal personnel responsibility.
* Experience working across multiple markets.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to influence and align stakeholders.
* A flexible and curious mindset, with a strong sense of ownership and follow-through.
* Fluent in English (Swedish not required).


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Additional information:
   

  

 This position is placed in Stockholm. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your application including
 **CV in English as soon as possible** 
 . Interviews will be held continuously. (For internal candidates, please initiate a dialogue with you manager before applying.)  If you are currently in a permanent employment with H&M you will keep your permanent employment even if you take on a temporary position for a limited time.
   

  

 Benefits:
   

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
   

  

 Inclusion & Diversity:
   

  

 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Product & Brand hybrid designer (Contract - 20 hours per week)
description:
**Filed is building the first AI tax preparer trusted by America’s accounting firms.**
 This industry might seem boring,but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it. Fast.
   

  

 In just 9 months, we’ve hit strong product-market fit, are generating insanely fast-growing, ridiculously sticky revenue, and are backed by top-tier investors. We’re not a tool—we’re the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We’re building the future by expanding our already 30-person team with those who want to say “I was there when it all started.”
   

  

 Read more → TechCrunch
   

  

**What We Should Tell You About The Role**
 We’re looking for a Product & Brand Designer on a contract basis (approx. 20 hours per week) to shape how the world sees Filed. You’ll take our functional, already-loved product UI and make it beautiful, cohesive, and ready for prime time across our website, blog, and social channels.
   

  

 This role blends product design precision with marketing creativity. You’ll be designing everything from polished UI visuals and illustrations to blog diagrams that make tax automation surprisingly understandable, and even a little fun.
   

  

**The teammate we’re looking for**
* You’re fluent in turning complex workflows into clean, compelling visuals.
* You have both a product design brain (clarity, UX logic) and a marketing eye (composition, hierarchy, storytelling).
* You can work independently and ship quickly from loose input.
* You know Figma inside out—components, variables, responsive design.
* You communicate clearly in writing and work async without drama.
* You’ve designed for SaaS or B2B products before.
* You’re fluent in English.


**Nice-to-haves**
* Light motion skills (Lottie, After Effects, or Principle) to bring flows to life.
* Familiarity with Webflow for quick visual iteration.


**What You’ll Be Responsible For**
* Turning product UI into marketing-ready visuals for Filed’s website, blog, and social.
* Creating modular illustration and diagram styles to explain workflows.
* Refreshing and unifying visuals across all marketing touchpoints.
* Delivering responsive, production-ready files for Webflow and other channels.
* Operating with very little direction while maintaining on-brand quality.


**Equal Opportunity**
 Filed is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you’re excited about this role but don’t meet every single qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway as we’re building a team of people with diverse strengths, experiences, and backgrounds.

title: Senior User Researcher
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you'll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 To succeed in our mission to create a great product experience, we are building a research team that can lead us into the unknown future of the Mentimeter product, fueled by our desire to challenge tomorrow's presentation and meeting experiences. We already have a great team in place, and we want to continue to learn and evolve as we grow.
   

  

 We are looking for a Senior User Researcher to join our growing team. As a User Researcher, you will help our Product teams gain a deeper understanding and empathy for our users, letting us improve the product to meet their goals and needs better. You will collaborate with Product Managers, Product Designers, Engineers, and Data Scientists to identify research questions, determine how to answer them best, and support teams to take action on research findings and insights.
   

  

**What you'll do:**
 In this role, you will be responsible for designing, scoping, and overseeing research initiatives to address our design challenges. Your role involves facilitating the synthesis of information, collaboratively generating insights and identifying opportunities in conjunction with product teams. Additionally, you will play a pivotal role in supporting and coaching designers in their research endeavours, contributing to the establishment of best practices for product teams and leveraging insights to enhance their designs. As part of the UX Research practice, you will actively participate in building and evolving the research team, focusing on refining methodology, tooling, support systems, training modules, and providing strategic guidance. The dynamic nature of the position requires effective management of multiple teams and research projects concurrently.
   

  

**Who are you:**
* 5+ years of user research experience with digital products, working in a cross-functional and fast-paced environment with design, product, content, marketing, and analytics teams. Ideally, you also have a background in human-centred design/design thinking.
* 3-5 years of startup or scale-up experience
* Experience using qualitative research methods in a product company.
* Expertise in scoping and managing research engagements throughout the human-centred design process in close collaboration with cross-functional stakeholders (marketing, design, product managers, customer success, etc.)
* Have experience with creating customer journeys or experience mapping.
* Familiarity with quantitative research methods, proficiency with metrics and A/B tests, and ability to synthesise quantitative data with qualitative user research.
* Experience working with ambiguous and unstructured questions, breaking them into relevant, concrete research work streams.
* Strong presentation skills with a creative and compelling storytelling style.
* Excellent facilitation skills to help lead research debriefs, brainstorming exercises or other workshops to fuel ideation and evaluate product design grounded in research findings.


**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It's not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**Location** 
 : Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Start** 
 : Early December 2025
   

  

**Duration** 
 : Parental leave cover starting January 2026 (approx. 12 months)
   

  

**Employment type:** 
 Full-time, hybrid (office / remote)
   

  

 We at Maandag Nordic is looking for a Frontend Developer to join a dynamic development team, filling in for a team member on parental leave from January 2026. This is a great opportunity for a result-oriented team player who prioritizes delivering value to users and has an interest in UX. The estimated start date is early December 2025.
   

  

 The client value curiosity, creativity, and collaboration. You’ll thrive if you enjoy sharing ideas, supporting colleagues, and driving initiatives forward together. You will contribute to both the technical and cultural strength of the team.
   

  

**About the Role**
 As a frontend developer in this team, you’ll work closely with experienced backend and frontend developers, as well as UX, Product, and Analytics colleagues, to shape innovative digital products. Your work will directly impact the experience for users on one of Sweden’s leading digital platforms.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain high-quality frontend solutions using Next.js.
* Collaborate in an agile development environment, contributing to sprints, planning, and reviews.
* Ensure the products you deliver are user-focused and scalable, working closely with UX and product teams.
* Support testing and quality assurance processes, including unit and integration testing.
* Contribute ideas and best practices to improve frontend architecture and workflows.


**Job requirements**
**To succeed in this role, we see that you have:**
* 2–3 years of professional experience as a frontend developer.
* Strong experience with Next.js
* Experience working in agile development teams.
* Based in or near Stockholm, able to work hybrid (office 3 days/week, 2 days remote).


**Meritorious experience:**
* Component libraries (Storybooks).
* Familiarity with Radix-ui.
* GraphQL.
* Jest for unit-tests.
* Playwright for integration tests.
* Amplitude for tracking and A/B-tests.
* Contentful CMS.


**Who You Are**
 You are a collaborative frontend developer who enjoys solving technical challenges while delivering user-focused solutions. You are curious, proactive, and thrive in an environment where you can influence both product and culture.
   

  

**Application procedure**
 A Maandag® recruiter will assess your application as soon as possible to determine whether you are suitable for an open position.
   

  

**About The Company**
 If you are a good match, we would like to receive a CV in WORD format with motivation why you fit this assignment, your availability and any scheduled holidays.
   

  

 Why Maandag Nordic? With us, you’ll get the chance to really put your ideas into action. We offer a work environment where you can grow and learn through hands-on experience - trying things out, making mistakes, and improving.
   

  

 For more than 35 years, Maandag® has been at the forefront of empowering people and organisations. We not only help professionals get jobs, but also connect them with a future that matches their values, desires and ambitions. Because when people are truly in the right place, they can develop themselves, fulfil their dreams and go to work with fresh energy every day. The energy and power released in the process is a catalyst for growth for companies. We started in the Netherlands, but now we also help professionals and organisations in Belgium, Poland, Dubai and Sweden. Our extensive knowledge of different markets, coupled with our wide network, enables us to make perfect matches quickly.

title: Site Manager
description:
**Join us to deliver a smoke- free future as Site Manager for swedishmatch.se!**
 We’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business and building our future with one clear purpose – to deliver a smoke-free future. Swedish Match is an affiliate of PMI and has been a leader in the industry for more than 200 years
   

  

 In the Nordic region, we are 1,600 employees based in Sweden, Denmark, Finland and Norway working in various functions and teams and together we are collaborating to deliver a smoke-free Nordics
   

  

**Role Summary**
 As a Site Manager, you will own and drive the strategy, development, and optimization of the Swedish Match Nordic websites on the Swedish Market to ensure best-in-class user experience, content engagement, and performance. This role is locally anchored for the Snus and Nicotine Pouch Category, where few/no global toolboxes exist and local design is essential due to unique Oral context in the Nordics. You will work close to cross-functional teams, including the Web & E-commerce Lead, Digital Solutions Lead, CRM team, Swedish Match Brand Retail, and external agencies located both in Sweden and global, to enhance digital touchpoints, improve organic and paid traffic, and optimize conversion rates. Your role will be based on real-world observations and analyses and involves site performance monitoring, SEO optimization, and continuous improvement to drive e-commerce traffic and revenue growth
   

  

**Please note that his role is a fixed term contract between 2025-12-01 – 2026-05-31**
**Main Responsibilities**
* Manage and maintain the company’s Nordic websites, focusing on swedishmatch.se, ensuring they align with brand, e-commerce, and digital strategy goals.
* Develop and manage the website content strategy, including content updates, landing pages, and product pages.
* Implement SEO best practices, including keyword optimization, metadata management, and technical SEO improvements to enhance organic search performance.
* Work with digital agency and brand team to create engaging web content that aligns with brand guidelines and legislations.
* Analyse and optimize the customer journey to improve user experience, engagement, and retention. Use A/B testing, heatmaps, and UX analytics tools to implement data-driven improvements.
* Evaluate online users’ behaviour to deliver engaging online experiences via constant Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) techniques.
* Monitor website performance, uptime, and loading speeds, ensuring optimal site functionality.
* Work with developing projects such as personalization and Ai-implementation.
* Regularly create presentations reporting on key website KPIs and provide actionable insights and strategies for continuous improvement and content improvement.
* Collaborate with the Digital Solutions team to implement new features, functionalities, and integrations that enhance site performance.
* Ensure compliance with web security, data privacy (GDPR), and accessibility standards (WCAG).
* Keeping up to date with industry best practice and monitoring content activities of competitor websites


**Who You Ar**
* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Business, Economics, or a related field.
* 5+ years in digital marketing and ecommerce (ideally acquired on retailing side or manufacturer, or at another key ecommerce category; durables/tech).
* General knowledge and understanding of the IT-technical aspects of E-commerce. Very good knowledge of the digital environment (incl. consumer journey and behavior) and platforms.
* Strong expertise with CMS tools, preferably Optimizely.
* Proficiency in SEO.
* Strong analytical and data-driven mindset, with experience in analyzing and reporting on channel performance metrics.
* Excellent communication, collaboration, and relationship-building skills, with the ability to influence and negotiate effectively. Proficiency in Swedish and English is required.
* Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritize effectively, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* Experience from collaboration with external agency partners and managing budgets


**What We Offer**
 Our success depends on the dedicated people who come to work every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join Swedish Match and you too can:
   

  

* Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
* Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.
* Enjoy flexibility of hybrid way of working - split your time between working from our office or the comfort of your home, where it works best for you in line with business needs.
* Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business – our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
* Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to deliver a smoke-free future.


 #SWMA
   

  

**17832**

title: iOS Developer
description:
Why This Job Is for You
   

  

 You want to be part of an engaged and collaborative team where you can deepen your expertise in software engineering, with focus on iOS app development, while continuing to grow your technical knowledge. You enjoy contributing to meaningful product development for both startups, large-scale product companies, and public organizations alike.
   

  

 At DDX we put people at the heart of our process. We create digital products that improve everyday life — not just for today’s users, but for future generations, with a lasting impact on both people and the planet. We choose the right tech for the task – iOS, Android, or modern multiplatform frameworks like React Native and Kotlin Multiplatform. We value your curiosity and willingness to explore new technologies.
   

  

 You will be working within our Hardware & Design business area, where we combine broad engineering expertise with deep specialist knowledge and a user-centered approach – to develop physical products and digital experiences all the way from concept to large-scale production.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, build, and maintain digital products, primarily iOS apps. Most often, in close collaboration and in joint contribution, with the corresponding Android app.
* Collaborate closely with designers and backend developers to craft seamless, user-friendly solutions.
* Work with CI/CD pipelines to ensure continuous integration and high-quality delivery.
* Participate in architectural discussions and influence tech decisions and design patterns.
* Evaluate and implement new technologies and frameworks to enhance the development process and user experience.
* Contribute to a collaborative, knowledge-sharing culture. Help guide our clients by understanding their goals and suggesting solutions that create real value for them—and us.


**Qualifications**
* You are an experienced iOS developer with solid skills in Swift (Objective-C is a plus).
* You have knowledge of many parts of the iOS toolchain, Apple frameworks, and commonly used third-party frameworks.
* You are comfortable with design patterns such as MVC or MVVM, and you write clean, well-architected, testable, and maintainable code.
* You have experience from customer-centric, iterative projects, creating high-quality iOS apps.
* You are familiar with unit testing and CI/CD pipelines.
* You care about system architecture, usability, and interface design, and enjoy working in cross-functional teams with designers, product people, and other developers.
* You are used to working in an agile environment with strong collaboration and code review practices.
* You thrive as a consultant — driven by curiosity for our clients’ business and needs, using your expertise to help them succeed and growing together with our team at Knightec Group.


**Meriting**
* Knowledge of Android development (Kotlin/Java).
* Experience with multiplatform frameworks such as React Native, Flutter, or Kotlin Multiplatform.
* Experience as web developer, frontend or fullstack.


**An exciting journey with Knightec Group**
 Semcon and Knightec have joined forces to become Knightec Group. Together, we are shaping Northern Europe’s leading strategic partner in product and digital service development – how cool is that?
   

  

 With a unique blend of cross-functional expertise and a holistic understanding of business, we help our clients realize their strategies – from idea to finished solution. At Knightec Group, you’ll find the skills, mindset, and drive needed to take on the most challenging and innovative projects.
   

  

 For our employees, this means incredible opportunities to help shape the future through meaningful projects at the very forefront of technology. Here, you’ll not only grow and develop, but also become part of something greater.
   

  

 Does this sound like the place for you? Join us on this exciting journey!
   

  

 Practical Information
   

  

 This is a permanent position with a six-month probationary period. You’ll be based in our central Stockholm office, but we support hybrid and flexible work arrangements. The ideal start date is as soon as possible, or by agreement. Apply no later than
 **2025-11-30** 
 .
   

  

 If you have questions about the role, contact Mikael Westh, Talent Acquisition Specialist. Due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page.
   

  

 We’re looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Master Thesis: Framework for AI System Adoption
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 We are offering a Master’s Thesis opportunity at Ericsson to develop a scalable, trustworthy, and user-friendly framework to adopt AI across operations. The project focuses on enabling easier AI integration with emphasis on scalability, trustworthiness, and usability, and includes real-world validation within Ericsson’s environment. You will gain hands-on experience with leading AI practices and tools (e.g., LangChain, n8n, mcp) while collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders to drive practical impact.
   

  

 This position is for 1 student and is based in Stockholm, Kista.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Design and develop an adaptable framework that enables easier adoption of AI systems across Ericsson’s operations, with a focus on scalability, trustworthiness, and usability.
* Conduct literature reviews and stakeholder interviews to identify adoption challenges such as trust, design, explainability, and ease of use.
* Create a practical implementation plan, covering tool integration, governance considerations, and AI engineering best practices.
* Apply the framework to a real-use case within Ericsson’s operations to assess feasibility, effectiveness and impact.
* Validate concepts through testing and measurement of outcomes, with iterative refinement from domain stakeholders.
* Produce comprehensive documentation and reports, with the potential for conference or publication-ready outputs.


**The skills you will bring:**
* Enrolled in a Master’s program in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Media Technology, or a related field.
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to reason about complex AI systems, governance, and compliance.
* Familiarity with AI frameworks and practical UX design considerations to improve usability.
* Interest in designing and evaluating trustworthy AI, including transparency and explainability.
* Interest in enterprise-scale deployments, integration methodologies, and scalability across operational domains.
* Comfortable working in interdisciplinary teams and conducting stakeholder interviews.
* Proficiency in English, with clear communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences.


**Application:**
 Please submit your application with a resume and academic transcripts from both your BSc and your MSc.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
