title: Senior Project Manager at Global Industrial Development
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are looking for a skilled Senior Project Manager with at least 10 years of experience in implementing new IT solutions together with new Business Processes to join us on our exciting journey. We are currently undergoing significant transformations in our Production & Logistics (P&L) operations and the accompanying IT Solutions, as we embrace the opportunities brought by digitalization.
   

  

 Our business architecture and IT solutions should be an enabler for our P&L business to take on new challenges and opportunities within our global production system. Our vision is to have an efficient, transparent, and automated global production system, using modern digital solutions to connect people, processes & equipment to support real-time decisions based on high quality data.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 As a Project Manager you will be driving the implementation of updated business processes along with new IT solutions at our Production Units. You will be a part of the implementation of the future for Scania.
   

  

 You will be responsible for the Project Plan and for the execution of that plan which includes co-ordination of all the deliveries from different sub-projects.
   

  

 You will work closely together with our Business Architects and Solution Architects as well as the receiving Business at our Production Units.
   

  

 As a member of our Industrial IT department, you will actively participate in our department's development and improvement initiatives, contributing to our collective progress.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 As a person you are a self-driven curious team player with a genuine interest in driving implementation projects of both new Business Processes and IT Solutions.
   

  

 You have good knowledge and experience in project management in this area. You have good skill in facilitating meetings and you are structured, pedagogic and communicative.
   

  

 To succeed in the role, you need social and analytic skills. You are used to taking your own initiative to create and maintain structures.
   

  

 You must be able to travel, the implementation roadmap is global and it´s very important to be close to the implementation teams around the world.
   

  

 We see that you have a Master of Science in Engineering, University degree in Information Science or corresponding knowledge. Working in the area between business and IT requires that you understand and can handle both perspectives.
   

  

 Furthermore, you have a very good knowledge of PDM/PLM, ERP and MES IT Solutions and business processes within Production and Logistics at Scania.
   

  

 You are fluent in Swedish and English and extensive experience working in international, cross functional organisations.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 Global Industrial Development is a unit within Production & Logistics (P&L) at Scania. The unit supports the operational sectors of Chassis & Cabs, Powertrain as well as Logistics. One of the responsibilities within the unit is Industrial IT.
   

  

 We can offer you a dynamic workplace with diverse and challenging tasks in a hybrid work setup, meaning you can work from home a few days a week if the job allows. We can also provide you with an individual development plan that you create together with your manager, so you can reach your goals and receive the right support along the way.
   

  

 We offer an exciting, dynamic, and international position that presents a wide range of challenges and opportunities for growth. Over the next five to six years, we have several initiatives that will influence the design and implementation of a new business architecture and IT solutions.
   

  

 Our future IT Landscape consists of three main cornerstones within PDM/PLM, ERP and MES.
   

  

 All efforts are part of the NOVA (New Order to delivery Architecture) Program, which receives high attention and expectations from Scania's top management.
   

  

 The department has a multicultural atmosphere and has many contacts globally at Scania.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses for an easy commute to Södertälje.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-10-31. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Head of Information Management and Preparation VEIE at Industrial IT within Global industrial Development, Klas Lundin, klas.lundin@scania.com.
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Specialistsäljare Education
description:
Är du redo att forma framtidens skola? Vi söker en passionerad specialistsäljare som vill vara med och utveckla vårt skolväsende. Vi söker dig som har en naturlig fallenhet för att bygga relationer och gillar att utmana våra kunder i deras vardag och leda dem på deras resa i att nyttja digitaliserade lösningar och digitala verktyg för utbildningsväsendet. Är det du? Välkommen till oss på Atea!
 



  





**Din roll** 




 Som specialistsäljare på Atea arbetar du med att skapa nya affärsmöjligheter och bygga långsiktiga relationer med kunder inom utbildningssektorn, främst i Region Stockholm. Du ansvarar för att sälja Ateas tjänster och lösningar, och tar en rådgivande roll där du hjälper kunder att navigera digitaliseringens möjligheter utifrån deras behov.
 



  





 Du ingår i ett nationellt team med starkt engagemang för skolutveckling och samverkar nära kollegor, partners och leverantörer. Rollen innebär både digitala och fysiska kundmöten, samt visst resande inom regionen och ibland nationellt. Du arbetar strukturerat med kundplaner och CRM, deltar i anbudsarbete och driver kundaktiviteter som seminarier och event.
 



 Placering för tjänsten är Kista, med planerad flytt till Solna våren 2026.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Ansvarar för försäljning till utbildningssektorn i Region Stockholm
* Skapar nya affärer och utvecklar befintliga kundrelationer
* Rådgivande roll inom digitalisering och teknikutveckling
* Samarbetar med kundteam, strategiska partners och leverantörer
* Genomför affärsmöten, presentationer och kundaktiviteter
* Deltar i anbudsarbete och håller dig uppdaterad om marknadstrender
* Arbetar strukturerat med CRM och kundplaner
* Reser vid behov inom regionen och ibland nationellt



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi söker dig som är affärsdriven, nyfiken och trivs med att samarbeta. Du har ett starkt säljdriv och är lyhörd för kundens behov – du vågar utmana, analysera och komma med insiktsfulla lösningar. Du är kreativ, inspirerande och har lätt för att ta initiativ, skapa relevant material och kommunicera det på ett övertygande sätt. Du är en lagspelare med passion för utbildning och skolutveckling, och har förmågan att se möjligheter där andra ser hinder. Du har ett stort intresse för hur digital teknik kan stötta verksamheter, gärna med erfarenhet från skolvärlden eller liknande miljöer. Du är van att hantera flera kunddialoger parallellt och har god förhandlingsvana.
 



  





**Krav för tjänsten:** 



* Erfarenhet av försäljning och att arbeta affärsdrivet
* Förmåga att analysera kundbehov och föreslå lösningar
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga i både svenska och engelska
* Erfarenhet av att hantera flera kundprocesser samtidigt
* God förhandlingsvana
* B-körkort
* Är obehindrad i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* Meriterande med bakgrund från skolvärlden eller utbildningssektorn



  





**Om Atea** 




 Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av it-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med it och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara it-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar it-värld.
 



  





 På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" – en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.
 



  





**Kontakt & mer information** 




 Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Carina Tillman, försäljningschef Atea Education, via carina.tillman@atea.se. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, ansök därmed redan idag!
 



  





 I den här rekryteringen kan arbetspsykologiska tester användas som en del av urvalsprocessen. Som en kvalitativ del i vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll för vissa av våra tjänster, detta för att öka kännedomen om dig som vår framtida medarbetare.
 



 Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



*Den här rekryteringen hanteras av oss på Atea och vi undanber oss därför samtal och mail från rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag* 
 .
 



**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: SAP IS-U CRM Security Consultant (Swedish Speaking)
description:
**SAP IS-U CRM Security Consultant (Swedish Speaking)** 




  





 Contract Type: 12-month freelance contract
 



 Location optional: Hybrid Stockholm or Helsingborg office (2-3 days per week)
 



  





**Language Requirements: Fluent in Swedish and English (both mandatory).** 




  





 We are seeking an experienced SAP IS-U CRM Security Consultant to join our client’s SAP Authorization team. The team is responsible for all authorization and security topics across multiple SAP systems. This role requires a highly skilled professional with 10–15+ years of SAP Security & Authorization experience who is fluent in Swedish and English.
 



 The successful candidate will participate in SAP implementation, rollout, and support/maintenance projects, ensuring compliance, security, and efficient authorization processes across SAP systems.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities:
 


* Participate in SAP implementation, rollout, and support/maintenance projects across multiple functional areas.
* Collect requirements, perform analysis, and write detailed security and project documentation related to SAP Authorizations.
* Configure SAP systems in line with security and authorization requirements.
* Conduct in-depth testing, continuous improvement initiatives, and review of existing Segregation of Duties (SoD) rules.
* Identify improvement opportunities, remediate SoD violations, and ensure compliance with internal policies.
* Collaborate closely with functional teams to ensure security and authorization requirements are met across projects.



 Required Competencies & Skills:
 


* Expert in SAP Security & Authorization, specifically in SAP IS-U CRM.
* Strong knowledge of SAP security concepts, SoD principles, and role/user management.
* Experience in SAP implementation, rollout, and support projects.
* Ability to perform requirement gathering, system analysis, configuration, testing, and documentation.
* Excellent problem-solving skills with attention to detail.



  





 Experience & Education:
 


* Experience: 10–15+ years in SAP Security & Authorization.
* Education:
* Minimum: Secondary School
* Preferred: University/College degree in IT, Computer Science, or related field.
* Industry Knowledge: Utilities preferred; exposure to related sectors is a plus.



  





 Business Processes & Applications:
 


* SAP Authorization projects and application maintenance.
* Strong understanding of SAP IS-U CRM modules.

title: Group Internal Control Lead
description:
Are you ready to take the lead in a role where structure meets strategy? At Dustin, you’ll take the lead in strengthening our internal control framework, ensuring it supports sound decision-making and compliance across the business, all within a collaborative, international, and listed company environment where your insights truly matter.
   

  

**This is what makes the position as Group Internal Control Lead unique**
* Play a key role in shaping Dustin’s Internal Control framework while collaborating across departments and influencing decision-making at group level.
* Take ownership of your work with the freedom to lead, plan, and drive improvements with real impact and visibility.
* Be part of Dustin’s growth journey towards becoming Europe’s leading IT powerhouse, and help build the Internal control structure to support it within the context of a listed company environment.


**Your role & influence as** 
**Group Internal Control Lead**
*Responsibility* 
 : You will be given responsibility for shaping and strengthening Dustin’s Internal Control framework, ensuring it not only functions effectively, but is fully embedded in daily operations and continuously evolves with the business. Foster a culture where accountability and ownership are embedded in daily operations, ensuring internal control becomes a natural part of the organization’s mindset.
   

  

*Collaboration:* 
 Together with your team, you take care of Dustin’s compliance and internal control responsibilities, working closely not only with your immediate colleagues but also with teams across the company, from employees to top management, to make sure we stay aligned, informed, and in control.
   

  

**Core Activities**
* Assist in identifying financial and compliance risks across the business, and support teams in linking them to the internal control framework and defining appropriate actions.
* Design, implement, and regularly test key internal controls to make sure they work as intended and stay up to date.
* Support control owners in testing their controls each year and help improve them where needed.
* Prepare clear and to-the-point reports and materials for Audit committee meetings and work closely with external auditors.


**Benefits Of Joining Dustin**
 We believe there's more to Dustin than just the benefits listed here. You'll fully understand this once you're with us. Curious? Our Life at Dustin - Dustin Sweden page has you covered.
   

  

**You can find more of our benefits below in the vacancy.**
****This is what we imagine you bring****
 We envision you as a curious and driven individual who enjoys working across teams, takes ownership of complex topics, and has a structured mindset with a sharp eye for risk, control, and continuous improvement.
   

  

**Additionally, It’s Important That**
* You have a bachelor’s degree, preferably in Finance, Business, or a related field
* You have experience working with internal control, compliance, or risk management in an international or complex organization
* You’re familiar with internal control framework (COSO) and control testing
* You’re comfortable working with both internal and external stakeholders, including auditors and senior management
* You have a good command of the English language, both written and spoken.


 We value additional qualifications such as proficiency in Dutch or Swedish, experience in auditing, and familiarity with OneTrust.
   

  

****What can you expect next?****
 To Ensure a Fair Recruitment Process Free From Unconscious Bias, We Handle Your Application Anonymously And Do Not Accept Cover Letters. Please Refrain From Sending One, So That The Selection Is Based Solely On Professional Competencies. We Expect The Following Steps In The Recruitment Process
   

  

* Telephone screening with TA partner
* 1st interview with Emma Oddestad (Manager Compliance) and Susanne Hamrén (Head of Group Financial Control)
* Assessment
* 2nd interview with somebody from the team or another leader
* Background check


 For questions about the position, please contact the TA Partner Manon van Lieshout via e-mail: manon.vanlieshout@dustin.com
   

  

**Please apply in English with an English resume.**

title: Global Talent Manager
description:
**About Securitas Group** 




**Securitas** 
 is a world-leading safety and security solutions partner that helps make your world a safer place. For 90 years, we have helped keep your world safe. It's a purpose we continue to pursue in today's complex and ever-changing world. Guided by our values of integrity, vigilance, and helpfulness, we create sustainable value by assisting our clients in optimizing their operations and protecting what matters most—their people and assets.
 



  





 Securitas is a knowledge leader in security, serving a wide range of customers across various industries and customer segments. Our protective services, developed in collaboration with our customers, are designed to incorporate a high degree of technology content. While manned guarding remains the cornerstone of Securitas, we continually evolve our offerings.
 



  





 Securitas offers the most comprehensive protective services portfolio in the industry and continuously innovates with solutions tailored to clients' businesses and needs. This enables us to build partnerships that grow alongside our clients.
 



  





 We employ 336,000 people and serve thousands of clients worldwide. In 2024, our total sales amounted to MSEK 161,921. Securitas is listed in the Large Cap segment on Nasdaq Stockholm.
 



  





 Securitas operates in 44 countries globally and is organized into three business segments: Securitas North America, Securitas Europe, and Securitas Ibero-America. The Group also operates in Africa, the Middle East, Asia, and Australia, which form the AMEA division. Additionally, the business unit Securitas Critical Infrastructure Services in North America is included under “Other” in segment reporting.
 



  





 We encourage you to read more about
 
 Securitas and our Values
 
 , as well as get familiar with the
 
 Annual and Sustainability report
 
 .
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As
 **Global Talent Manager** 
 , you will play a pivotal role in advancing our global Talent and Leadership agenda. You will lead key strategic initiatives to strengthen our talent landscape and ensure that we have a robust pipeline of future leaders across the organization. This role combines strategic vision with hands-on execution — balancing global process ownership with close collaboration across regions, business divisions, and senior leadership teams. To thrive in this role, you are a team player with excellent communication and coordination skills. You are analytic, structured and proactive, and comfortable leading complex initiatives involving multiple stakeholders across different countries and functions.
 



  





**About the team** 




 This is a global
 **Subject Matter Expert** 
 (SME) role where you will be joining the
 **Global People** 
 team on Group Level consisting of approximately 7 members in a variety of different HR roles.
 



  





 The role reports to
 **Global VP People & Culture** 
 .
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Act as a global process owner for
 **Talent Management** 
 and
 **Succession Planning** 
 , ensuring alignment, quality, and impact across the organization.
* Lead and facilitate the annual
 **Talent Review** 
 process for the Group Management Team (GM).
* Further develop and embed
 **Succession Planning** 
 and
 **Leadership Assessment** 
 practices to secure a strong leadership pipeline.
* Own and manage the
 **Executive Development Program** 
 (EDP) – including program design, budget, delivery, external partnerships, and alumni engagement.
* Lead the
 **global 360° feedback** 
 process and platform, ensuring consistency and value in leadership development efforts.
* Provide
 **strategic guidance** 
 and
 **expertise** 
 to divisional and functional HR leaders on global programs and initiatives.
* Chair the
 **Global Talent Community** 
 , bringing together Talent Directors from all divisions.
* Support the global roll-out of the
 **Management Toolbox** 
 and
 **Leadership Framework** 
 .
* Drive talent analytics and reporting, translating insights into actionable recommendations.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Extensive expertise (min.
 **7-8 years** 
 ) in Talent Management, Leadership Development or Strategic HR in a global context.
* Experience working with
 **senior stakeholders** 
 (C-level preferred) and leading complex, cross-border projects.
* Proven ability to deliver end-to-end responsibilities, from
 **strategy development** 
 to
 **hands-on execution** 
 .
* Background in consultancy is a plus. A must is previous experience from a global role and multiple years in international context.
* Experience with HR technology, analytics platforms, and digital transformation in talent processes.
* Experience with various assessment tools for leadership development programs (e.g., 360-degree feedback) and managing third-party providers (such as executive coaches, L&D vendors, D&I partners, executive search, etc.).
* At least a bachelor’s degree, preferably a master’s degree, in a relevant field such as Business Administration or Human Resources.
* Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills; business and commercial acumen. Strong skills in teamwork, influence, and leading change.
* Excellent command of
 **English** 
 , both written and spoken.
* A hands-on, pragmatic mindset aligned with Securitas’ down-to-earth culture.
* An excellent fit with non-corporate Securitas culture.



  





**Location** 




 The role is based in Sweden at
 **Stockholm HQ** 
 at Group Functions and involves occasional travel as needed.
 



  





 Hybrid working model is applicable (2-3 days per week working from office).
 



  





**What we offer?** 




 At
 **Securitas** 
 we believe in doing the right thing and doing it well. For our customers and our employees. Our employees come from all walks of life and bring with them a multitude of talents and perspectives. We aim for diverse representation throughout the company, and we are committed to equal pay, safe working conditions, gender balance and an inclusive work environment with a wide range of skills and development opportunities.
 



  





 If you’re ready to lead strategic talent development and drive leadership growth in fast-evolving security sector, apply now to become our Global Talent Manager at Securitas Group!

title: Partner Success Manager
description:
We are super excited to announce that Jacob Brander is looking for the next Partner Success Manager to Voyados Partner Success team.
   

  

 As Partner Success Manager for Voyado Elevate, you’ll be part of our Services organization, the team responsible for ensuring operational excellence and delivery quality across Voyado’s product suite. You’ll sit at the intersection of technology, enablement and operations. Helping our Solution Partners master Voyado Elevate- from Search and Merchandising to Recommendations.
   

  

**Some of the things you'll be up to:**
 You’ll make sure our partners have the technical know-how, best practices, and support they need to succeed — not just during implementation, but throughout the entire customer lifecycle. You’ll work closely with teams across Services, Customer Success, Product, and Sales to build scalable partner enablement programs, strengthen collaboration, and grow partner maturity across markets.
   

  

* Enable partners to design, implement and optimize Elevate solutions covering search, merchandising, and recommendation logic.
* Provide hands-on technical and operational guidance, helping partners build scalable and reusable implementations.
* Develop and deliver structured enablement and certification programs focusing on Elevate's functionality, API usage and performance optimization.
* Partner with Customer Success to ensure partners drive adoption and measurable business results and sustained customer value.
* Conduct governance reviews and track partner readiness, integration health and delivery quality.
* Act asa bridge between partners, Services and internal teams sharing insights that strengthen Voyado's partner ecosystem


 This is a unique opportunity to step into a newly created and strategically important role where you’ll help shape how Voyado collaborates with partners for years to come.
   

  

**So, who are you?**
 To thrive in this role you bring a structured and solution-oriented approach and you're someone who enjoys turning complex challenges into clear, actionable outcomes. You know how to plan, prioritize, and build repeatable frameworks that scale. Collaboration comes naturally to you; you build strong relationships, communicate clearly across teams and value transparency. Above all, you’re proactive and driven, taking initiative and pushing ideas forward.
   

  

* Proven experience from a technical customer- or partner-facing role within e-commerce, retail tech, or martech.
* Hands on understanding of APIs, integrations and data flows, confidence discussing them with both technical and business stakeholders.
* Familiarity with modern web technologies or scripting (e.g., JSON, REST APIs, JavaScript, Python, etc.).
* Experience driving measurable results, such as improved adoption, conversion or other key performance metrics.
* Strong communication skills in English, both written and spoken.


 What's in it for you?
   

  

 Voyado wouldn’t be the powerful platform it is without the people behind it. We really care for our Voyadoers and some examples of what we can offer you are:
   

  

* An engaged team with a knowledge-sharing and friendly culture
* Summits where we hang out, workshop, discuss, and have a good time together
* Opportunities for personal and professional growth and learning in a dynamic and supportive environment.
* Work-life balance – we don't have a long work-hours culture, we value engagement over hours worked.
* An office-first but flexible hybrid working policy.


 Some of our benefits:
   

  

* 30 days of vacation, so you can spend time on the things you love
* Beneficial bike lease, including e-bikes
* Breakfast buffet on Fridays
* Inhouse gym only for Voyadoers
* A generous gadget-and-phone package (your choice!)
* 5000 SEK per year in wellness allowance
* A wellness hour you can use every week


**About Voyado**
 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, Voyado makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.
   

  

 We are now a company of 350+ colleagues on an exciting journey and have recently established a presence in new markets to strengthen our position in Europe. If you are ready for your next adventure and want to join our team on our expansion throughout Europe and have an interest in customer care, e-commerce, retail, and tech - let's get in touch!
   

  

****Be yourself 🏳️‍🌈****
 At Voyado, we believe in gender equality. We are proud sponsors of Womengineer as well as Tjejer Kodar! Read more about Tjejer Kodar & Voyado here
   

  

  

  

 Equality is not only about gender but also about making everyone feel welcome and heard in a multicultural and diverse environment. We at Voyado strive to make everyone feel like they can bring their true self to work every day. Gender-equal and diverse teams have more perspectives on life and bring different ideas to the table which in the end leads not only to making a better working environment but also a better product.
   

  

 Ready to find out more?
   

  

 Lovely! 🎉
   

  

*Before one applies it can always feel like you need a better resume, more polish, or just another year of experience, but we say if you think this sounds like a place where you can shine don't hesitate to send in your resume!*
**Making it personal with AI**
 We truly believe you’ll position yourself best for success in the interview process by being yourself with support from AI where it makes sense, later in the process you will even be expected to use AI. But at the end of the day, what matters is meeting you, the person behind the application.
   

  

 There is no such thing as a perfect candidate; we’re all human so please, bring your authentic self! Don’t let AI over polish your CV or answers to the point where we can’t hear your real voice because that’s what we care about the most.
   

  

*Note: As of right now we are unable to proceed with applicants outside of the EU, and a requirement of eligibility to work at Voyado is the right to work in the EU without limitations. Needless to say, this is something we are actively working on to be able to onboard colleagues from all over the world.*
 Voyado is the customer experience platform made for retail. We help brands turn every interaction—from first click to repeat purchase—into lasting loyalty.
   

  

 With AI-powered tools for search, personalization, marketing, and loyalty, we make it easy for retailers to grow and connect with customers in smarter ways.
   

  

 Loved by 400+ brands, Voyado is on a mission to become Europe’s most beloved retail companion.

title: Research Specialist in Membrane Spatial Biology
emails: ana.teixeira@ki.se, ana.teixeira@ki.se, helin.norberg@ki.se, helin.norberg@ki.se, bodil.moberg@ki.se, bodil.moberg@ki.se, elizabeth.valenzuela@ki.se, elizabeth.valenzuela@ki.se
description:
**Do you want to contribute to top quality medical research?**
 The Nanomedicine and Spatial Biology Lab at the Department of Physiology and Pharmacology, Karolinska Institutet, is seeking a talented research specialist to join our team. Our research focuses on investigating the roles of spatial organization in biological processes. To achieve this, we develop DNA nanotechnology-based tools to map and manipulate membrane protein nanodomains (e.g. Spratt, Dias et al., Nature Nanotechnology, 2024; Ambrosetti et al., Nature Nanotechnology, 2021; Shaw, Lundin et al., Nature Methods, 2014.)
   

  

**Description Of The Subject Area**
 Membrane proteins assemble into dynamic nanodomains that regulate receptor signaling and trafficking. Disruption of this spatial organization is implicated in diseases such as cancer and neurodegeneration. Nanodomains have the potential to be used as biomarkers and therapeutic targets. To realize this potential, we develop methods for large-scale, high-resolution mapping of the composition and nanoscale architecture of membrane protein nanodomains across physiological and disease states.
   

  

**Your mission**
 We are seeking a research specialist to drive innovative projects at the intersection of spatial biology and nanomedicine. The candidate will develop novel methodologies to analyze the spatial organization of proteins within cell populations and single cells.
   

  

**Eligibility Requirements**
 For employment as Research Specialist at Karolinska Institutet, the eligibility requirements stated in the Guidelines for non-teaching positions at Karolinska Institutet are applied in relation to the established profile of employment.
   

  

 To be eligible for employment as a Research Specialist, in addition to holding a Degree of Doctor, PhD, or having a foreign degree deemed equivalent to a Swedish doctoral degree, the applicant must have demonstrated research expertise as well as have documented postdoctoral research experience.
   

  

**Assessment criteria**
***It is particularly meritorious that the applicant has shown***
* Expertise in DNA nanotechnology, computational biology, cell biology, and in vivo studies in zebrafish and mouse models
* Excellent communication skills and motivation to work collaboratively
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects in parallel
* Proficiency in spoken and written English


***It is meritorious that the applicant has shown***
* Expertise in the design, production, and purification of DNA origami nanostructures, as well as in methods for analyzing cellular responses, including scRNA sequencing and advanced microscopy


 After an overall assessment of the expertise and merits of the applicants in relation to the subject area, Karolinska Institutet will determine which of them has the best potential to contribute to a positive development of the activities at KI.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 A creative and inspiring environment with wide-ranging expertise and interests. Karolinska Institutet is one of the world's leading medical universities. Here, we conduct successful medical research and hold the largest range of medical education in Sweden. At KI, you get to meet researchers working with a wide range of specialisms and methods, giving you ample opportunity to exchange knowledge and experience with the various scientific fields within medicine and health. It is the crossover collaborations, which have pushed KI to where it is today, at the forefront of global research. Several of the people you meet in healthcare are educated at KI. A close relationship with the health care providers is important for creating groundbreaking top quality education and research. Karolinska Institutet is also a state university, which entitles you to several benefits through our collective agreement.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Solna
   

  

 https://ki.se/en/research/research-areas-centres-and-networks/research-groups/nanomedicine-and-spatial-biology-teixeira-lab
   

  

**Application**
 We prefer that Your application is written in English, but You can also apply in Swedish. An application must contain the following documents: PhD certificate, resumé, qualifications and description of planned research, presented in accordance with Karolinska Institutet's qualifications portfolio.
   

  

 Welcome to apply at the latest November 9th 2025.
   

  

 The application must be submitted through the Varbi recruitment system.
   

  

**Want to make a difference? Join us and contribute to better health for all!**
 Anställningsform: särskild visstidsanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 % | Ort: Solna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: STÖD 2-4213/2025 | Kontakt: Ana Teixeira ana.teixeira@ki.se, Ana Teixeira ana.teixeira@ki.se, | Facklig företrädare: Helin Norberg, SACO helin.norberg@ki.se, Helin Norberg, SACO helin.norberg@ki.se, Bodil Moberg, ST bodil.moberg@ki.se, Bodil Moberg, ST bodil.moberg@ki.se, Elizabeth Valenzuela, SEKO elizabeth.valenzuela@ki.se, Elizabeth Valenzuela, SEKO elizabeth.valenzuela@ki.se, | Publicerat: 2025-10-24 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-11-09

title: Technical Product Manager – Operational Excellence (Bangkok-based, relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose -** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team**
 We are looking to hire a Technical Product Manager (TPM) to join our team and drive operational improvements across our global tech organization. Agoda’s TPMs play a key role in developing internal tools and platforms that improve how teams work and collaborate. In this role, you’ll focus on Operational Excellence—enabling Agoda Tech to become more effective in non-coding activities such as internal support, performance tracking, planning, and cross-functional alignment.
   

  

 The Operational Excellence domain is responsible for identifying friction in our workflows and creating systems that promote clarity, consistency, and efficiency at scale. This includes initiatives such as optimizing meeting effectiveness, automating internal processes with LLMs and AI, improving visibility into OKRs and team velocity, and more. The impact of this work is felt across thousands of employees and multiple functions.
   

  

 This is a high-visibility role, working closely with senior leaders across Tech. It is well suited to someone who is energized by navigating complex organizational environments and building solutions that support large-scale transformation.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 As a TPM for Operational Excellence, you will lead the design, delivery, and adoption of internal tools and systems that improve the way our tech teams operate. You will work with stakeholders across engineering and product teams to understand current workflows and pain points, define opportunities, and prioritize impactful changes. While specific projects will evolve over time, your mission will remain consistent: help Agoda Tech work smarter. Success in this role requires strong systems thinking, excellent communication skills, and the ability to drive change across a large and fast-paced organization.
   

  

**In This Role, You’ll Get To**
* Own the product lifecycle from concept through implementation and iteration.
* Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and cross-functional leaders to understand internal challenges and develop scalable solutions.
* Influence without authority, aligning diverse stakeholders behind a shared vision for operational improvements.
* Work closely with Tech senior leadership to ensure alignment, visibility, and buy-in for key initiatives.
* Use data to inform prioritization and track the impact of your work over time.


**What You’ll Need To Succeed**
* 3+ years of technical product management experience in a fast-paced environment.
* 5+ years total technical experience in engineering, internal platforms, developer tools, infrastructure, or similar domains.
* Experience designing or improving internal tools or systems used across large organizations.
* A strategic mindset with strong problem-solving skills and an ability to simplify complex processes.
* Comfortable navigating ambiguity and defining structure where it does not yet exist.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills—able to build trusted relationships with senior stakeholders across multiple disciplines.
* Experience working with data to support decision-making (e.g. dashboards, KPIs, basic SQL, or working with analysts).
* Experience with AI/LLM tools or automation technologies is a plus, but not required.
* This position requires a successful candidate to relocate fully to Bangkok, Thailand, where relocation support is provided.

**Discover More About Working At Agoda**

* Facebook https://www.facebook.com/agodacareers/

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: Biträdande enhetschef
description:
**Till enheten för it-utveckling på Åklagarmyndighetens huvudkontor söker vi en biträdande enhetschef.**
**Om arbetet**
 It-utvecklingsenheten är en av fem enheter på Åklagarmyndighetens it-avdelning. Det är också den största enheten sett till antalet medarbetare som inklusive konsulter är ca 80 stycken. Det är en dynamisk miljö där både tekniker, jurister, projektledare och andra samverkar i syfte att ge myndighetens anställda bästa möjliga it-stöd. På enheten löper också flera projekt och förvaltningar parallellt. Både sådana som initierats myndighetsinternt men även från det myndighetsgemensamma uppdraget, Rättsväsendets Digitalisering. Därtill kommer uppdrag från regeringen och från EU-samarbeten.
   

  

**I Din Roll Ingår**
* att bistå i arbetet med att organisera, planera och leda arbetet
* att bidra till en god arbetsmiljö där medarbetarna trivs och blir sedda
* att ha personalansvar för ungefär en tredjedel av de anställda medarbetarna
* att tillsammans med enhetens övriga chefer ha ansvar för de konsulter som finns på enheten.
* att tillsammans med resterande it-ledningsgruppen ansvara för it-avdelningen genom att på ett övergripande plan analysera föreliggande risker och konsekvenser för avdelningen och utifrån detta föreslå lösningar och göra prioriteringar för it-utvecklingsenheten.


**Dina kvaliteter och kvalifikationer**
**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* har relevant akademisk utbildning eller annan erfarenhet och utbildning som bedöms likvärdig
* har flera års erfarenhet av it-verksamhet och har ett genuint intresse för it-utvecklingsfrågor
* har god teknisk förståelse och förmåga att förstå de krav som ställs på myndigheten genom lagstiftning och regeringsuppdrag.


**Det Är Meriterande Om Du Har**
* erfarenhet av att leda andra
* erfarenhet av systemutveckling inom it-området
* erfarenhet från statlig verksamhet, särskilt inom rättsväsendet.


 När Vi Anställer Kommer Vi Att Lägga Stor Vikt Vid Personliga Egenskaper Och Ledarskapsförmågor. Som Grund För Den Bedömningen Ligger Åklagarmyndighetens Ledarkriterier. Ledarkriterierna Anger En Beskrivning Av Ett Önskvärt Ledarskap Inom Åklagarmyndigheten Och Omfattar Följande Förmågor
   

  

* stabilitet
* helhetssyn
* kommunikationsförmåga
* social förmåga
* förmåga att nå mål och resultat
* förändringsförmåga.


**Om anställningen**
 Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning med en provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 Tester förekommer i rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och därmed sker säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav för denna anställning.
   

  

 Åklagarmyndigheten är en beredskapsmyndighet. Vid en anställning kan du komma att krigsplaceras på Åklagarmyndigheten. Läs mer under Jobba hos oss.
   

  

 På grund av arkivbestämmelser sparar vi ansökningar i två år. När du ansöker kommer dina personuppgifter att behandlas enligt offentlighetsprincipen samt dataskyddsförordningen. När du skickar din ansökan till oss, samtycker du till detta.
   

  

**Åklagarmyndigheten som arbetsgivare**
 På Åklagarmyndigheten känner vi stolthet när vi går till jobbet. Tillsammans är vi närmare 2 300 engagerade och kompetenta medarbetare som står upp för rättssäkerhet, rättstrygghet och demokratiska värden. Oavsett roll i myndigheten så bidrar alla till vårt viktiga samhällsuppdrag.
   

  

 Vill du bli en del av Åklagarmyndigheten? Vi strävar efter att vara en välkomnande och inkluderande arbetsplats som speglar samhällets mångfald.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Arbetsledare till Boo Energi - Elnät
description:
Boo Energi står inför en expansiv fas med ökande efterfrågan på elnätstjänster, driven av tillväxt i området och utbyggnad av flexibilitetstjänster exempelvis solenergi och energilager. Med en modern företagskultur och fokus på service och kvalitet, erbjuder nu Boo Energi rätt person en unik möjlighet att vara med och påverka/bidra till företagets utveckling i en bred och ansvarfull roll som Arbetsledare.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som Arbetsledare på Boo Energi får du vara med i ett spännande bolag som är i en förändringsfas och verkar i ett expansivt område. Du kommer få arbeta i en verksamhet med ny teknik, moderna lösningar, korta beslutsvägar, bra gemenskap och många kontaktytor såväl internt som externt. Det händer mycket i branschen och i bolaget. På Boo Energi får du jobba med att säkerställa en trygg, effektiv och framtidssäkrad drift av elnätet och bereds stora möjligheter att komma med nya idéer och att påverka utvecklingen framöver.
 



  





 Som Arbetsledare ansvarar du för:
 



 • Driva nätombyggnadsprojekt samt drift- och underhållsprojekt i fält enligt budget och tidplan. • Arbetsplanering från daglig nivå till en årsplanering för 10 montörer.
 



 • Samverka med bolagets projektörer samt exploatörer för att planera det praktiska utförandet av montörernas jobb i fält.
 



 • Följa lagar, instruktioner och föreskrifter inom teknik och arbetsmiljö.
 



 • Delegerat arbetsmiljöansvar för montörer.
 



 • Beställa kompletterande material och avropa schaktarbete.
 



 • Inneha rollen som BAS-U och samordna arbeten med externa aktörer.
 



 • Säkerställa att dokumentation och tillstånd finns för Boo Energis uppdrag.
 



 • Kontrollera att idrifttagningskontroller utförs. Du leder och fördelar arbetet med fokus på affärsmässighet, effektivitet och att gruppen känner engagemang, förtroende och delaktighet.
 



  





**Din profil** 




 Du är engagerad, strukturerad och har en strategisk förmåga att tänka nytt och driva förändring. Ditt teknikintresse och viljan att ta ansvar gör att du trivs i en miljö där du kan påverka och bidra till utvecklingen. Du är social, utåtriktad och leder ditt team med en god balans mellan ett tydligt ledarskap och att lyssna in dina medarbetare. Samtidigt är du pedagogisk och trivs med att lära dig nya saker, vilket passar perfekt i bolagets utvecklingsfas mot ökad digitalisering. Du trivs med att ta ansvar i en bredare roll och att bidra med tankar och idéer.
 



  





 Vi tror du är/har:
 



 • Högskoleingenjör inom el eller annan utbildning inom el + relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
 



 • Erfarenhet av ledarskap
 



 • Erfarenhet från branschen - eldistribution, elbolag, entreprenörer
 



 • Goda kunskaper om elbranschens lagar, krav och riktlinjer.
 



 • Praktisk erfarenhet av elinstallationsarbete i någon form med fokus inom eldistribution.
 



 • God IT-vana och förmåga att arbeta digitalt.
 



 • B-körkort. Rollen som arbetsledare är verksamhetskritisk och kräver en kombination av teknisk kompetens, ledarskap och strategisk förståelse.
 



  





 Boo Energi söker en person som vill bidra till bolagets utveckling och ta ansvar för framtidens elnät.
 



  





**Övrig information** 




 • Placeringsort: Björknäs med goda kommunikationer och parkeringsmöjligheter
 



 • Start: Enligt överenskommelse
 



 • Varaktighet: Tills vidare
 



 • Arbetstid: Kontorstider med flexibilitet och frihet under ansvar
 



  





 Boo Energi har valt att samarbeta med Maxkompetens i denna rekryteringsprocess. Har du frågor angående tjänsten så kontakta gärna ansvarig rekryterare på Maxkompetens, Anders Gustavsson via mejladress: anders.gustavsson@maxkompetens.se Urval och intervjuer kommer ske löpande i denna process så ansök gärna på www.maxkompetens.se redan idag! Ansökningar via e-post mottages ej på grund av GDPR.
 



  





**Om Maxkompetens** 




 Maxkompetens är ett av Sveriges ledande rekrytering och bemanningsbolag sedan 2003 och har kontor på fem orter fördelade på Kristianstad, Växjö, Halmstad, Borås och Stockholm. Varje år tillsätter vi över 1200 jobb och varje dag har vi ca 280 konsulter ute på uppdrag. Våra kompetensområden är HR & Lön, Ekonomi & Finans, Kundtjänst & Administration, Marknad & Försäljning, It & Teknik, Inköp & Logistik, Industri. Varje människa har en fantastisk potential. Det är viktigt att ta vara på alla människors kompetens och erbjuda dem möjligheten att uppnå sina drömmar. Genom omsorgsfullhet, väl fungerande rekryteringsprocesser och hög kompetens hjälper vi människor och företag att mötas och lyckas tillsammans. En bättre värld helt enkelt! Vi är ett auktoriserat bemanningsföretag med kollektivavtal, försäkringar, friskvård och tjänstepension.
 



  





**Om kunden** 




 Boo Energi grundades 1920 som ett lokalt energibolag. Vi ansvarar för utveckling och underhåll av elnätet i Saltsjö-Boo samt i delar av Värmdö och Vaxholm. Vi strävar efter ett pålitligt elnät som kan möta både dagens och framtidens krav av elektrifiering. Vårt utbud inkluderar konkurrenskraftiga elavtal och förmånliga energitjänster som är tillgängliga över hela Sverige. Våra energilösningar förändras i takt med den tekniska utvecklingen, som vi ser är viktiga delar i uppbyggnaden av ett hållbart samhälle. Vi är stolta över vår lokala närhet, långa historia och vi värnar om det personliga mötet. Vi erbjuder prisvärda produkter och tjänster med teknik i framkant och med fokus på vårt klimat. Boo Energis koncern är indelat i elnät (Boo Energi ekonomiska förening), elhandel (Boo Energi Försäljnings AB), och Boo Energi AB. Boo Energi ekonomisk förening Vi underhåller och utvecklar elnätet i Saltsjö-Boo samt delar av kommunerna Värmdö och Vaxholm. Vårt nätområde har en yta på 36 km2 och ägs av våra kunder och medlemmar. Vi sätter dig som kund i fokus med kunnig personal och ett säkert och tryggt elnät. Vi arbetar för att ha ett säkert elnät med så få avbrott som möjligt och har de senaste åren haft en leveranssäkerhet på 99,99 %.
 



  





**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 2025-11-19

title: Supply Chain Manager
description:
**ValueOne söker en erfaren Supply Chain Manager för ett konsultuppdrag hos vår kund i Stockholm. Uppdraget ska tillsättas snarast och beräknas sträcka sig över sex månader med syfte att övergå till en anställning. För rätt person erbjuds goda utvecklingsmöjligheter.** 




  





*ValueOne är specialister inom Supply Chain Management – inköp och logistik. Vi erbjuder våra kunder tjänster inom tre affärsområden: uthyrning och rekryteringsstöd inom vårt specialistområde samt verksamhetsutveckling av företags funktion för Supply Chain avseende strategi, modell, metod, process, organisation och kompetens.* 




*Vi kan erbjuda en mängd olika uppdrag på alla nivåer inom Supply Chain Management. Som konsult hos ValueOne ingår du i ett professionellt och driftigt team bestående av de främsta konsulterna inom inköp och logistik. Väljer du att gå med i vårt team erbjuds du:* 



* *Marknadsmässig lön, som du själv kan påverka*
* *Tjänstepension*
* *Sjuk- och vårdförsäkring*
* *Friskvårdsbidrag*
* *Personlig coachning och karriärrådgivning*
* *Nätverksträffar med kompetenta kollegor och Supply Chain professionals genom återkommande event och föreläsningar*
* *Kompetensutveckling genom världsledande individanpassade utbildningar och kurser inom Supply Chain tack vare vårt partnerskap med CIPS (www.cips.org)*



  





**Om rollen** 




 I rollen som Supply Chain Manager ansvarar du för att leda arbetet med Customer Order Management och logistik. Du rapporterar direkt till VD och ingår i företagets ledningsgrupp.
 



 Du kommer att arbeta operativt med kundorderhantering, samordning av leveranser och bokning av transporter. Rollen innefattar även att etablera och utveckla basen av kontrakterade transportföretag, planera produktvolymer genom olika distributionskanaler samt utveckla metoder, modeller, rutiner och processer. Du ansvarar för långsiktig strategisk planering av nödvändig kompetens och verktyg, samordnar global efterfrågan på viktiga leverantörer och föreslår förbättringar av intilliggande processer. Vid behov stöttar du även andra funktioner inom företaget.
 



  





**Erfarenhet och kompetens** 




 Vi söker dig som har en akademisk examen inom logistik eller motsvarande. Du har 5-10 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med Supply Chain Management, gärna inom bränslesektorn. För att bli aktuell för uppdraget krävs även erfarenhet av transporter av flytande kemikalier eller liknande. Det är meriterande om du har arbetat med bil och sjöfrakt, särskilt bulk. Du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i både tal och skrift. Du har god vana av att arbeta med flera IT-system och har kunskaper i Business Intelligence-verktyg.
 



 Som person är du en driven, strukturerad och lagspelare som är ödmjuk men tydlig. Du har en stark vilja att driva förändringar och anta utmaningar, samt mycket goda kunskaper inom Supply Chain.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Vi hanterar ansökningar och tillsätter uppdrag löpande, så skicka gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Har du frågor om uppdraget är du välkommen att kontakta Frank Hemgren på telefon 070 748 18 91alternativt 010 332 29 20.

title: Geometry Assurer
description:
Scania's R&D department is transforming to become part of TRATON Group R&D. TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

 Role Summary
   

  

 The Geometry Assurer ensures the quality of the digital geometry within the TRATON modular system throughout the entire development process. The role focuses on making sure designs are buildable and identifying any issues that could hinder this. It involves analyzing models and structures using geometry assurance tools and supporting design teams by creating and maintaining complex digital environments. Operating at a complete vehicle level, including chassis, cab, and bus projects, the position requires a strong understanding of the modular system. Ultimately, the Geometry Assurer plays a key role in maintaining design integrity and ensuring the final product meets all specifications.
   

  

 Job Resposibilities
   

  

  

* Analyze and validate digital models using advanced geometry assurance tools.
* Build and maintain complex environments to support design teams.
* Work across complete vehicle levels – chassis, cab, and bus projects.
* Drive continuous improvement and highlight critical deviations early.
* Collaborate in an agile setup with PI planning, sprints, and daily stand-ups.


 Who You Are
   

  

  

* Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent.
* Experienced in CAD/DMU and geometry analysis tools.
* Strong understanding of modular systems and complete vehicle architecture.
* Excellent communication skills and a structured way of working.
* Curious, proactive, and eager to make a difference.


*We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.*
 This Is Us
   

  

 You’ll join an engaged and open-minded team that values collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning. We believe in supporting each other, sharing knowledge, and celebrating success together.
   

  

 As your manager, I am dedicated to building a team culture based on trust, openness, and collaboration. I value transparency, encourage new ideas, and believe that every voice matters. My goal is to create an environment where you can grow, feel supported, and make a real impact.
   

  

 Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Being bigger also means being stronger. Together with our brands, we have the collective power to transform transportation.
   

  

 We Offer
   

  

 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-11-09. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

**If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:**
 Åsa Ottergren; asa.ottergren@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: DevOps Engineer till Sveriges Riksbank
description:
Riksbanken är Sveriges centralbank med uppdrag att säkerställa låg och stabil inflation, att det finansiella systemet fungerar effektivt och att betalningar kan genomföras säkert. Som en samhällsbärande myndighet är vi en nyckelspelare i svensk ekonomi. Vi genomgår en omfattande förändring i hur vi arbetar med IT-utveckling, data och analys. Och du har möjlighet att vara med och påverka.
   

  

 Som DevOps Engineer får du en avgörande roll i att driva den tekniska transformationen och bygga nästa generations utvecklingsplattform. Du kommer att vara med och forma en modern, containerbaserad infrastruktur och fatta beslut som sätter riktningen framåt för bankens tekniska framtid.
   

  

**DET HÄR GÖR DU HOS OSS**
 Som DevOps Engineer är du del av vårt nyetablerade team DevSecOps. Vi är på en resa där du har alla möjligheter att påverka och forma hur vi bygger upp alltifrån arbetssätt till vår tekniska plattform.
   

  

 Du har en central och drivande roll och samarbetar nära utvecklare, arkitekter, infrastruktur- och säkerhetsspecialister för att bygga upp en modern, containerbaserad utvecklingsmiljö. Du omger dig med kompetenta och engagerade kollegor som delar din passion för teknisk excellens. Ditt fokus är att förenkla vardagen för utvecklingsteamen samtidigt som du säkerställer att vår plattform förblir robust, skalbar och säker.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter**
* Designa och implementera CI/CD-pipelines med automatiserade säkerhets- och kvalitetstester
* Forma och underlätta övergången till Kubernetes-baserade utvecklings- och driftsmiljöer med säkra CI/CD-processer och ökad autonomi
* Bygga utvecklarverktyg och processer för containerbaserad utveckling
* Integrera säkerhet i hela utvecklingsflödet från kod till produktion, exempelvis genom automatisering av tester, säkerhetstester och kodscanning.
* Stödja utvecklingsteam med rådgivning, on-boarding och praktisk konfiguration


 För rätt person finns möjlighet till att axla än mer ansvar.
   

  

**DITT TEAM**
 DevSecOps-teamet är ett nytt team inom enheten IT-utveckling och Dataplattform. Enheten består av ca 15 anställda samt ett antal konsultteam. Du arbetar tätt med utvecklingsteam, data engineers, infrastrukturspecialister och säkerhetsexperter i en miljö som värdesätter teknisk excellens och kunskapsdelning.
   

  

**MER OM DIG**
 Vi söker dig som är strukturerad och initiativtagande med stark fokus på kvalitet och värdeskapande. Du drivs av nyfikenhet och håller dig ständigt uppdaterad inom den tekniska utvecklingen. Problemlösning är en av dina främsta styrkor och du trivs med att arbeta agilt i tvärfunktionella team där du tar ansvar för helheten och bidrar som en naturlig lagspelare.
   

  

**Skallkrav**
* Flerårig erfarenhet av DevOps engineering
* Flerårig erfarenhet av Linux-miljöer och utveckling (Python, Go eller motsvarande)
* Flerårig erfarenhet av CI/CD i Kubernetes-miljöer
* Erfarenhet av Azure DevOps Server, GitLab eller liknande verktyg
* Flytande svenska och engelska


**Meriterande Erfarenhet**
* Systemadministration inom Linux
* Administration av Kubernetesmiljöer
* Arkitekturarbete
* CI/CD-flöden i on-prembaserade miljöer
* Molnbaserade miljöer och IaC
* Agila arbetsmetoder och GitOps-baserade arbetsflöden
* Arbete med system med höga krav på säkerhet och tillgänglighet
* Akademisk utbildning inom datavetenskap eller annan relevant utbildning


**MER OM TJÄNSTEN**
**Tillträde:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Anställningstyp:** 
 Tillsvidareanställning, provanställning tillämpas
   

  

**Placering:** 
 Huvudkontoret Brunkebergstorg Stockholm
   

  

**Arbetstid:** 
 Förtroendearbetstid
   

  

**Möjlighet att jobba distans:** 
 1 eller 2 dagar i veckan
   

  

**Förmåner:** 
 Generösa semestervillkor, löneväxling till pension, subventionerad lunch, friskvårdsbidrag, subventionerad massage och tillgång till gym och ledarledda träningspass.
   

  

 Tjänsten kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning innefattande registerkontroll och särskild personutredning kommer att göras på slutkandidaten. I vissa fall ställs krav på svenskt medborgarskap och säkerhetsprövningssamtal för säkerhetsklassade tjänster.
   

  

**ATT JOBBA PÅ RIKSBANKEN**
 Riksbanken ser till att pengarna behåller sitt värde över tid och att betalningar kan ske säkert och effektivt. Vi ger också ut Sveriges sedlar och mynt. Vi arbetar på medborgarnas uppdrag för en stark och säker ekonomi. Här får du utmaning och utveckling varje dag i en händelserik miljö. Hos oss får du kunniga och engagerade kollegor och stor möjlighet till kompetensutveckling. Huvudkontoret är beläget på Brunkebergstorg mitt i centrala Stockholm. Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta på Riksbanken här.
   

  

**ANSÖK**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Riksbanken med rekryteringsföretaget Computer Sweden Recruitment. Deras rekryterare gör ett första urval i samråd med rekryterande chef samt utför intervjuer. De kandidater som går vidare träffar sedan rekryterande chef.
   

  

**Vid frågor** 
 är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Alexandra Tihinen, ansvarig rekryteringskonsult på 070-447 92 24 eller alexandra.tihinen@csrecruitment.se.
   

  

 Vi vill ha din ansökan senast
 **31 oktober** 
 . Vi vill att du i denna rekrytering besvarar ett antal urvalsfrågor. På så vis kan du enkelt söka tjänsten och vi ges möjligheten att utvärdera våra kandidater på lika villkor. Logiska tester och arbetsprov kan komma att ingå som en del av rekryteringsprocessen. Vi genomför också bakgrundskontroller på slutkandidaterna, vilket innebär att du lämnar in examensbevis eller annat dokument som styrker din utbildning och vi kontrollerar att dessa stämmer.
   

  

 Du kan läsa mer om hur det fungerar när du söker jobb på Riksbanken här . Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Principal Research Scientist - Music
description:
We are seeking a Principal Research Scientist to join our Artist-First AI Music lab. Our team pioneers and advances state-of-the-art generative technologies for music that create breakthrough experiences for fans and artists. We invent entirely new listening experiences that center and celebrate artists and creatives. All of our products will put artists and songwriters first, through these four principles:
   

  

**Partnerships with record labels, distributors, and music publishers:** 
 We’ll develop new products for artists and fans through upfront agreements, not by asking for forgiveness later.
   

  

**Choice in participation:** 
 We recognize there’s a wide range of views on use of generative music tools within the artistic community. Therefore, artists and rightsholders will choose if and how to participate to ensure the use of AI tools aligns with the values of the people behind the music.
   

  

**Fair compensation and new revenue:** 
 We will build products that create wholly new revenue streams for rightsholders, artists, and songwriters, ensuring they are properly compensated for uses of their work and transparently credited for their contributions.
   

  

**Artist-fan connection:** 
 AI tools we develop will not replace human artistry. They will give artists new ways to be creative and connect with fans. We will leverage our role as the place where more than 700 million people already come to listen to music every month to ensure that generative AI deepens artist-fan connections.
   

  

 For more information, see this press release: https://newsroom.spotify.com/2025-10-16/artist-first-ai-music-spotify-collaboration/
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Conduct ground breaking research in music generation (diffusion, flow matching, or autoregressive models), as well as related domains like ML-based audio processing, music information retrieval, machine learning, and signal processing.
* Run large-scale experiments with access to Spotify’s extensive infrastructure and an audience of more than 700 million monthly active users.
* Create practical applications that harness generative technologies, pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in listening experiences.
* Collaborate as part of a cross-functional team—working closely with scientists, engineers, product managers, designers, user researchers, and analysts—to craft innovative solutions to complex challenges.
* Have a direct impact on Spotify’s products, tools, and services, working on projects that influence the entire organization.
* Engage with the broader research community by publishing your findings, delivering talks, and attending top conferences.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have a Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field. Previous industry experience is helpful.
* You have experience in one or more of the following fields: generative modeling, machine learning, music information retrieval, speech processing, audio processing, signal processing, probabilistic modeling, computer vision, or related areas.
* You have publications in communities such as ICASSP, ISMIR, INTERSPEECH, ICLR, AAAI, IJCAI, NeurIPS, ICML, CVPR, ECCV, ICCV, or related.
* You have strong coding skills in the following languages/libraries: Python, PyTorch, NumPy.
* You are a creative problem solver who is passionate about building outstanding products that add real value to millions of people.
* You are enthusiastic about learning more about turning research ideas into products operating at scale.
* You can explain complex topics in simple terms, and you enjoy building strong relationships with colleagues and stakeholders.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! For this role, you can be within the EMEA region as long as we have a work location
* This team operates within the Central European and GMT time zone for collaboration.
* Core working hours are CET 3pm-6pm / EST 9am-12pm.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Talent & Influencer Marketing Manager
description:
*J.LINDEBERG is a global lifestyle brand with the vision of becoming the world’s most desirable and successful sports and fashion brand. Defined by a unique style that is both effortlessly sophisticated and supremely comfortable, we fuse creativity with progressiveness to design fashion and performance wear that is sustainably sourced.*
*Working at J.LINDEBERG gives you the opportunity to learn and grow with some of the most talented, fun and passionate people in the industry. If you like things to move fast, have an entrepreneurial spirit and never settle, you’ll fit right in. Innovation is close to our hearts, and we continuously take action to minimize our impact on the world we live in.*
**Job Summary**
 The Talent & Influencer Marketing Manager, within the Global Marketing & Communications Team, is responsible for building and executing a comprehensive influencer and talent strategy, including paid partnerships, ambassador programs, product seeding, and athlete collaborations. This role will work cross-functionally with PR, Social Media, Content Marketing, E-commerce, Retail and Product teams to ensure cohesive storytelling and campaign execution across all consumer touchpoints.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Strategy & Planning**
* Develop and own the influencer and talent marketing strategy across all tiers with a focus on athletes and lifestyle influencers aligned with the brand.
* Identify strategic opportunities for ambassador programs, including world class sports athletes, and long-term partnerships to build credibility and community.
* Plan and manage seasonal influencer campaigns, including product launches, brand moments, and co-branded initiatives, in alignment with marketing calendar and go-to-market strategy.
* Ensure all influencer and talent partnerships reflect J.LINDEBERG’S commitment to diversity, inclusion, and sustainability.


**Partnership Management**
* Source and negotiate contracts with athletes, influencers, and talent agencies for both paid and unpaid opportunities.
* Oversee influencer seeding programs - from list development to outreach, fulfilment, and follow-up.
* Maintain strong, ongoing relationships with talent, serving as their primary point of contact (with some exceptions in local markets).


**Campaign Execution**
* Lead the briefing, execution, and reporting of influencer and athlete campaigns - ensuring deliverables align with brand messaging and KPIs.
* Track content delivery, review performance metrics, and analyse ROI on paid and organic partnerships.
* Collaborate with Creative and Social teams to ensure influencer content meets brand guidelines and can be repurposed across channels.
* Manage order processing and shipment of goods, including coordination with delivery services, monitoring shipments, and ensuring timely delivery.


**Cross-Functional Collaboration**
* Partner closely with PR, Social Media, Digital Marketing, Content, CRM, Retail and E-commerce teams to integrate influencer efforts into holistic marketing campaigns.
* Work closely with Design and Product Development team regarding special productions for Athletes.
* Support experiential and PR activations involving talent, including events and product launches.
* Work with Product and Operations teams to manage inventory for seeding and gifting.
* Work closely with teams at local markets for execution and roll-out of strategy.


**Reporting & Analysis**
* Manage talent and influencer budget, track spend and ensure cost-effective investment across channels.
* Create monthly and campaign-based reports summarizing performance, reach, engagement, and sales attribution.
* Monitor industry trends and emerging platforms to keep the brand at the forefront of talent and influencer marketing.
* Monitor compliance with global advertising and disclosure regulations.


**Qualifications**
* 4–6 years of experience in international influencer marketing, talent relations and brand partnerships, ideally in the sports, fashion or lifestyle industries.
* Deep understanding of the social and influencer landscape, including current platforms, creator trends, and best practices.
* Proven success in building and scaling influencer programs with measurable impact.
* Strong negotiation and communication skills, with experience managing contracts and talent relationships.
* Highly organized, proactive, and comfortable managing multiple projects simultaneously, including end-to-end responsibility and ensuring goods are ordered, packed and delivered to talents and influencers.
* Proficiency in digital analytics and social listening tools.
* Experience using influencer marketing platforms (e.g., Lefty, Upfluence, CreatorIQ, GRIN, In/Golf, Traackr) and tracking tools (e.g., UTMs, affiliate links, Shopify/GA).
* Passion for sports (golf interest is a plus), culture, and community-driven marketing.


**The J.Lindeberg Values**
* Progressive - We strive to be at the forefront, and we dare to challenge the status quo. It comes from our Scandinavian heritage – we are innovators within apparel, use of resources and ways of working.
* Energetic - We bring energy into everything we do. We are entrepreneurial and agile. We are ready to do more and better each time. It makes our brand vibrant and magnetic.
* Inclusive - We are a people company. We are diverse and responsible. We act with integrity and take full accountability for what we do. We are a global community. We care for the planet and each other.


 Please apply as soon as possible, but no later than 17th of October. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.
   

  

 Founded in Stockholm 1996, J.Lindeberg inspires unconventional thinkers to live life to the fullest. The international fashion house bridges fashion and sport, offering sophisticated, edgy and comfortable products for a modern active lifestyle. The collections bring together creativity and Scandinavian progressiveness – for innovative fashion and outdoor lifestyle wear that is sustainable and delivered through a customer-focused, seamless experience.
   

  

 With headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden, the distribution covers more than 35 countries. There are 157 J.Lindeberg stores in several of the major fashion capitals of the world, such as Copenhagen, New York, Tokyo, Hong Kong and Shanghai. The wholesale distribution features close to 2000 stores, including the leading high-end department and specialty stores around the world.

title: Tax Technology Specialist
description:
Do you want to help shape the future of tax advisory? KPMG offers a unique opportunity to take a leading role in the growth of their tax transformation business. You'll work closely with Nordic and global networks in a flexible culture. Together, we make a real impact – for our clients, the industry, and your career.
 



  





**The Role** 




  





 KPMG Sweden is seeking an experienced and dynamic Tax Technology Specialist to join the Tax Transformation team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in tax technology and data management to support clients in developing and implementing innovative tax solutions. You will play a critical role in building out our practice to support our client in shaping their tax data strategy, creating tax technology roadmaps, and guiding them through vendor selections. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of building out our practice, driving business development, and enhancing the value of our services.
 



  





**Your responsibilities will include:** 




  




* Lead KPMG Sweden’s Tax Technology and Tax Data Management practice including developing and implementing innovative data-driven strategies to address client challenges and opportunities.
* Collaborate with clients to develop a comprehensive tax data strategy that aligns with their overall business objectives. This involves understanding their unique tax data landscape and challenges. Analyse their tax data maturity, identify gaps, and define data needs that align with their business objectives.
* Collaborate with clients to develop a tailored roadmap for optimizing their tax data management. This might involve recommending and implementing new technologies, data cleansing procedures, and automation tools.
* Collaborate with both client tax and finance departments to integrate tax technology solutions that enhance compliance processes and unlock valuable insights from their data.
* Partner with compliance and process specialists to identify opportunities for automating manual tasks and streamlining client tax and finance workflows and processes.
* Leverage your tax and technology expertise to identify new client opportunities for Tax Transformation services by leveraging existing client relationships, identifying new opportunities and effectively communicating the value of our tax transformation services.
* Build a collaborative and inclusive team environment that promotes continuous learning, knowledge sharing, and innovative thinking within the Tax Technology practice.



  





 The role is based in the office on Vasagatan in Stockholm, for the right person placement in another location is possible.
